description: recommendation make reservation pork rib special night crispy halibut salad fat tug oyster chickpea fritter smoker frazier duck breast they switch up menu because they are farm table restaurant which make nice since you can get variety alcohol also farm table you will not find tour typical brand hard liquor

could not ask more slow night restaurant they about close but accommodated u we very hungry but not wanted eat heavy we ordered chickpea fritter n beet salad n omg my best chickpea fritter ever heavenly fresh n soft eat beet salad even better guess fresh ingredient flavoured well in fact there many food item tempted eat but not watch my big growing stomach forgot name my cocktail but delicious n refreshing there are good desert well like cheesecake toffee caramel truffle loved ambience n decor inside peck clean n covid precaution taken staff very gracious n smiling would love go back try duck dish

whoa it s been and wait worth now vegan it s been hard find really good place fancy pant dining am in love with place food everything perfect and it s got everything from vegan vegetarian and blood eater alike dish start chickpea fritter chickpea and plant based eater it s happy marriage they come single and could eaten meal and roasted beet yummy they had pasta special vegan which pesto and pea shoot plate fantastic love my green give plate full green i m super happy my pescatarian love ordered salmon dish which also sounded amazing except weird combination chorizo in thought should add should not plate could missed not paying attention not surprise non meat eater would appreciate eaten in little bit everyone price are little bit high but would definitely back date

came brunch date saturday around noon and got seated right away but we definitely got last open seat in restaurant you re coming prepared start getting crowded around then liked how they sweet and savory option their menu they offer variety different egg benedict we opted their traditional egg benny and their french toast good however portion size little small what you re paying egg benny perfectly done yolk runny and flavor good really liked these rostis thats side it like flattened tater tot crispy goodness their french toast one thicc slab bread topped with mascarpone cream farm fresh berry and candied walnut dish little too sweet my liking really impressed with bread toast very caramelized outside but inside very soft felt like we eating dessert haha their staff kind and patient and helpful ambiance in restaurant definitely comfortable yet little fancy and could romantic meal too

there are many brunch spot stretch th ave and fable one better option they recently expanded their menu include frittata and toast avocado blt etc sampled veggie frittata with creamy goat cheese asparagus and healthy pile green top served with delicious potato r sti side toast and housemade raspberry jam component came together beautifully and r sti are more like sophisticated flattened tater tot in best possible way darling show in my book along with fresh raspberry jam service warm and efficient frittata are listed taking minute menu but everything seemed served up with speed restaurant can seem bit dark especially you re seated near back but in experience worth repeating in my book total bill with tax and tip came out about which again vancouver s magic number brunch lunch sans drink

such treat coming spend evening in kit with life long friend we planned dinner before firework and we re thrilled when we able get spot fable last minute restaurant from exterior not look like anything special but walking just few step inside confirmed reservation good choice we walked past bar in front open kitchen and cannot lie little envious their seat love cooking and sitting there would been dream watching them put out those plate pure pleasure haha we keep walking though our table back intimate and simple modern farmhouse restaurant our waiter funny engaging and efficient had great knowledge ingredient used in menu developed from farm table concept love type cooking super enjoyable hearing great attention providing food equally delicious fresh and local drink menu something everyone our husband not drink alcohol having really creative non alcoholic beverage really well received haha knowledge our server had wine menu u girl enjoy glass wine with our meal food very satisfying freshness creativity presentation flavour profile bang thank you fable lending u seat such enjoyable night great food laughter and conversation we will highly recommended and hope back soon
really excited about coming because i ve heard much however service really slow and food mediocre got egg benedict and nothing rave about however hash brown really good

fable been my list long time and i m disappointed taken long try out love they support local farm and get fresh ingredient daily they even rooftop garden grow their ingredient we came my birthday dinner and greeted quickly by hostess they open kitchen right front with bar seating well regular table in back we told by server their dish are meant family style which most ideal trying bit everything oyster fish chip each order only piece medium sized beer battered fried oyster tartar topped with mini french fry perfect spoonful deliciousness batter light and tartar refreshing balance rooftop serrano pepper appy quite large u there about small roasted pepper in white foam topped with chicharron spiciness pepper are always surprise but not worry these range little sweet mildly spicy smoked duck breast perfectly cooked tender duck breast with roasted parsnip duck confit croquette and cabbage croquette tasted more like carrot potato croquette however bc halibut with short rib pea risotto miso and halibut dashi dish my least favourite because halibut overcooked halibut pan fried leaving outside crispy but inside dry there only few small piece short rib but they quite tender pea risotto with dashi tasty even with many pea in overall wonderful birthday dinner
cool diner feel nice setup and good food very reasonably priced

cute little place brunch my boyfriend and came sunday and there wait around noon we ordered benny our server little frazzled but super friendly good service and good food super busy weekend i d recommend going little earlier you can

we stopped lunch our way out town after husband read great review we just popped in hoping there would place u and they great job accommodating u restaurant fun vibe with awesome and unique chandelier in center and interesting art wall whole restaurant pretty small including dining area tiny little open kitchen and couple small bathroom in back they good job with space though and lot nice seating our server really nice and attentive they gluten free option their menu and able point in right direction husband can never turn grilled cheese little boy inside him win every time smile side table disappeared think pretty spot had burger lettuce wrapped and good we had nice service and quick and pleasant lunch before heading back seattle area

had dinner night visiting kitsilano from seattle occasionally i ve found yelp review overinflated when visiting city looking you portland however fable fully deserves excellent reputation it s garnered food favorite entree tie gnocchi with double add pork belly and duck breast seriously order closely followed by steak steak s crispy potato understated however two cheese aligot aka cheesy whipped potato which also come with entree my overall favorite side balanced out favorite appetizer duck meatball and tomato soup beet solid appetizer cute and flavorful there nothing regret eating and price point are reflective portion size overall agree their pricing fall somewhere yelp google but when you factor in amazing quality relative what you pay agree with yelp s classification value sat kitchen bar and enjoyed watching plating like open kitchen concept since helped optimize what try subsequent visit no regret about eating gnocchi twice and duck steak once during trip however come back next thing would order are sablefish overlooked seafood but one table ordered their entree going assume they know something not and get duck again only mildly curious about rissoto salmon although looked beautiful usually when eat out straight up optimize taste value and am ambivalent dining experience but fable delivered too which must begrudgingly admit won over restaurant manager not only remembered when came back second evening remembered how liked my water can barely get place in seattle recognize go in once every week much le care about my preference non monetary item skipped night eating there and when came back hostess still remembered where like sit service throughout meal attentive without feeling intrusive ambience decor very nice not worked in restaurant before but place generally seemed dynamic engaged and high functioning team e g server double checking plated order before delivering them table everyone in kitchen voicing their opinion what keep thing running well back end there also smaller interaction made feel like staff genuinely cared whether had good experience e g not blanket recommending higher priced daily special when asked their opinion two entree option explicitly reminded not tip by when my bill included gift card hope i ll get visit vancouver again soon because perfect spot unwind and enjoy great food after long day

fable dine out date visit having previously tried their diner location we very curious try it sibling restaurant we started with fabled virgin blueberry juice pomegranate syrup fresh grapefuit juice soda citrus ginger soda fable made citrus ginger syrup sode which refreshingly tart wife found too sharp we ordered chick pea fritter appetizer which turned out delicious falafel with curry mayo and pickled red onion which lightened otherwise slightly dense dish with their acidity main my wife ordered sqash gnocchi with pork belly extra ordered seared ling cod her squash gnocchi pumpkin seed provided nice crunch dish thats not something ever thought gnocchi needed but we really enjoyed being non protein main nice generous portion also reason added glazed pork belly which also delicious when combined with hazelnut beurre noisette ricotta cheese my ling cod perfectly cooked one side skin nice and crisp but perhaps bit too crisp fish adjacent skin had hardened minor quibble flavour spot mashed potato and cream sauce wasn t listed menu maybe hollandaise harmonized very satisfying dish except portion wise small stole good chunk mr gnocchi keep from starving realize higher end meal fit into smaller budget often lead dine out menu essentially being tasting menu would prefer higher priced but more entree sized main we ordered each dessert initially lemon meringue parfait and sticky date pudding mind blowing lemon meringue parfait with london fog ice cream yes probably from rain shine nearby and taste identical theirs and struesel perfectly balanced lemon curd we ve been hooked trying different sticky pudding since trying gordon ramsey s his steak house in vega often with le than desirable result one good not need ice cream balance whipped marscopone and candied pecan added texture and dimension they tiny they re served in small jar but good we ordered another one each and swapped dessert additional each food highest calibre but we left hungry we assumed portion had been shrunk dine out but turn out their regular portion are small based dine out alone star recommended tiny but perfectly executed dessert gnocchi chick pea fritter avoid arriving empty stomach amazing can make review short no okay i ll go egg benny out world amazing sauce perfectly acidic hate sauce that s just fat with nothing cut through place hyped up damn good reason

breakfast d real hard during long weekend trip vancouver recently and one few disappointment brunch visit fable service and atmosphere great but food really fell short star how service and atmosphere cozy vibe fable complimented by fast and friendly service really had no complaint star star how portion relative cost got farmer s muffin which essentially open faced breakfast sandwich not unreasonable price point given size dish star star and how food it s thing stayed grounded during my visit fable simply wasn t great dish and wouldn t in my mind been much better served proper breakfast sandwich english muffin fine but nothing special and set tone rest dish egg also nothing special with bit standard cheese and hashbrown soft and squishy opposed crispy peripheral green and jam not much save thing and whole wasn t impressed no star star would you eat every day you could had amazing breakfast experience in vancouver ranging from jam cafe th parallel but fable not quite cut no star

am personally huge fan fable my favourite go dish gnocchi absolutely amazing such great flavour and texture die they used serve with pulled pork which miss dearly because personally believe combined much better than pork belly their chickpea fritter are another one my favourite everything perfectly balanced out garnish pickled onion and sprout compensate heaviness frying and sauce absolutely delicious you can always count fable everything perfectly cooked like their poached egg always and instagram worthy ooze when you cut into there are only two downside can think first might fact it s pricier side but quality ingredient and effort and detailing given preparation food make cost understandable second sometimes in term flavour dish your order you try switch up from what you usually order might little hit and miss but probably due fact everyone different flavour preference there are many special and menu rotates often and change often sometimes you might fall in love with dish just disappear few month later insert broken heart emoji but least really demonstrates how they focus having freshest most in season ingredient and they re constantly focused finding and showcasing best flavour

should listened jw marriot concierge when they pretty much ignored my question when asked about restaurant what happens when you are hangry and you just want eat you are regular eater place would just fine you but those are more critical and even want delicious healthy option then go somewhere else really not eat unhealthy processed food my comment food no good quality healthy option service pretty lame our server like zombie but attitude change when bill served only good service we got from hostess place very loud nothing special will not recommend regret went and will not return customer
we love fable it s our number restaurant go food amazing smaller portion but very high quality ingredient it s worth price

came saturday morning brunch cozy homey rustic vibe low ceiling and close proximity table made pretty noisy atmosphere waitress recommended scrambled egg and french toast off menu ordered smoked salmon benedict special found benedict luke warm by time came my table and english muffin bit burnt overall found bit sour my taste but salmon pretty fresh hash brown side came with benedict delicious

came not knowing what getting into and i ll admit best stumble had pleasure stumbling we biking through seaside route we slowly got more and more hungry doing quick google search restaurant in area we settled fable and parked our bike about block away despite being fully booked and during dinner time we able grab two seat bar when we seated guy bar asked we had been there before and later given run menu we had friendly conversation how we could not drink we biking salmon broccolini good my partner said really liked veggie however we agreed spaghetti meatball captured our heart cutting into duck meatball we saw juice come out onto pasta delicious could not hold back my excitement when asked how my meal long story short love place now and want come back again try rest their dish great service and amazing food

turned out blessing in disguise our initial yelp find had u in long line u stayed and went check out another option no wait and farm table done deal service very friendly and server provided suggestion had my first ceasar canadian form bloody mary loved seasoning and flavor food we ordered made each person eager share piece their meal and each taste supported another reason come back another time pork shoulder bennie cornbread base hollaindaise amazing pork moist and flavorful had barbeque sauce which hesitant about but worked wes s meatball skillet reminded meatball shop in ny meatball moist and tasty with italian flavor in sauce added bonus our sweet tooth son had his french toast which enjoyed by no syrup needed johnny cake similar except my daughter s pancake had cornmeal base oh moist and had softness pancake there tasty shredded pork top yum yum would we come back definite yup yup

fable kitchen renowned canadian restaurant run by trevor bird and must say soaring higher level than run mill restaurant wait long seated establishment however because it extraordinariness might good make reservation simply wait seat open up by taking walk around kit commercial neighbourhood we ordered four their evening dish chickpea fritter canned tuna crispy pork rib and pan seared gnocchi dish exceedingly tasteful elegant and novel chickpea fritter appeared simple falafel but much much more potato like and crispy texture complemented by it golden sauce and crisp fresh herb topping gone in two bite needle say canned tuna anything but and can t help but appreciate effective and comedic use irony consisted fried bread and gourmet fish dipping combination hit with u and almost immediately eaten entirely mostly by like eating luxury tuna luxury rice that s good thing and not even gotten rib but when gone in instant whatever sweet nectar like sauce addicting flavour could not get enough basil surprisingly went well with rib and tender savoury bean excellent complement sweet crispy rib last but not least gnocchi indeed non traditional but exceptional melt away expectation pair excellently with smooth white cream and yellow squash pur e form triage comfort and indelible soothing softness round out already wholesome dish soft pumpkin seed and seared kale are added fray complete dish my first time fable not expecting anything yet blown away by culinary experience not only food great but service not mention washroom clean and spacious with subtle lighting perfect one those bathroom selfies course restaurant great photo wooden beam and red brick make vibrant background i ll still rate five star because masterful food portion are surprisingly french sized e smaller than what will sate person with hearty appetite look forward trying fable again with bated breath

went fable lunch friday with my husband around pm and literally there not another single person in place surprised but also meant we got pick seat and full attention staff which really nice soooo excited see they had croque madam menu one my favorite warm cheesy with egg sandwich amazing loved had pickled onion with two beautifully soft egg top and bacon jam with ham inside had parmesan foam well and wasn t sure what going like but amazing definite must try like sweet and savoury breakfast sandwich my husband not much but still really enjoyed taste and flavour combination accompanied with simple fricasee salad fresh and had light oil and vinegar dressing happy we tried place lunch now we ll come back dinner
best salmon and gnocchi with pulled pork service exceptional smores also great

good eats food super fresh and portion weren t overwhelming large enjoyed handcrafted pasta which best i ve ever had and we also tried tomato soup accompanied by grilled cheese had nice and crisp crust my son had fable burger and fry not care over seasoned and ate about quarter ambience nice small restaurant and dimly lit during day offered wine list however we not try we returning work overall would recommend those enjoying fresh and quality food

great service and food we had reservation pm but had arrived really early they able accommodate my friend and earlier which great had smoked duck breast and my friend had pasta special sorry but can t remember name duck breast tender juicy and delicious seasoned with cocoa caraway pickled mustard bit different and not think went with duck not use service efficient friendly and very helpful we asked recommendation food and wine my friend hasn t been there before when we went and had food really liked

came brunch with friend food got salmon egg benny and we shared french toast salmon very fresh and benny good overall but not think my style food french toast though another story toast huge with lot different fruit and topping and texture very chewy and sweet which really enjoyed service our server very impatient about giving u time order we said we needed minute few time and always gave u few second before coming back haha but then during meal when we needed service no where found ambience liked design place very dark and artistic but table very small crowded and therefore very loud

came weekday during winter holiday lunch with group friend place pretty much empty we able get table quickly but fill up pretty quickly closer noon ambience casual and service top notch our server attentive patient and gave good recommendation food overall food saltier side appetizer and vegetable are small medium sized and good sharing definitely recommend brussel sprout crispy brussel sprout with good crunch outside not overly oily rest dish saltier side but seasoned perfectly pistachio added good crunnchhh king oyster mushroom little heavy parmesan side my personal taste but mushroom very fresh meh spaghetti meatball duck wayyy too salty cream pasta sauce pretty rich with good flavor but flavor overshadowed by salt meatball slightly overcooked duck meat and again very salty think they made few smaller meatball instead one large meatball may cook more evenly drink caesar decent pretty standard overall good experience and would go back again try their brunch menu but beware salty dish

place bomb first discovered fable fan trevor bird from watching top chef canada and delighted realize my new apartment in vancouver would street from restaurant fable my go place when friend coming town casual night out with friend even date night it s also my place dessert believe not rarely ever order dessert restaurant unless it s special occasion but you must try dessert you come live in vancouver you gotta try fable least once i ll let food talking but i d bet money you won t disappointed

after eating most amazing dinner we talked about coming back breakfast we are again hard describe everything we experienced when eating than say every unique bite crafted perfection and thought out from ingredient finish our server claude made dinner even more enjoyable with his quick service and great knowledge offering whenever we visit vancouver we will come back and promise

went fable sunday morning brunch and not wait table service very very nice and fast definitely fancier brunch place little bit more pricey but they present their food like it s high end restaurant and fable mean farm table which mean they source everything from local farm got farmer muffin which enjoy with side bacon liked their black peppered jam complimented sausage we ll their potato nice and crispy and soft in inside portion are small guy mostly my boyfriend left still hungry felt satisfied not overly full but good enough portion

fable my favorite restaurant in vancouver food and drink are superb staff and owner are friendly and attentive and atmosphere cozy and classy seared gnocchi our favorite dish and their old fashion are amazing it s best book reservation they take walk in fill up fast we got in by coming few minute before they opened pm

from first moment last fable delivered incredible experience not only because every dish bursted in flavour but service engaging and fun by wonderful european gentleman think it s tempered french accent not quebecois cause can actually enunciate word fable sits th avenue near kitsilano beach dining room quite dim sits receded back into space front section their open kitchen with it s glorious smell spilling into street though very dim you can still make out room which whimsical with it s decor note from farm lighting fixture are pickforks and wall are exposed brick with lot warm golden wood everywhere rooster found in different spot around room in addition standing proudly their sign give thanks fable not cramming in table point you re sitting another person it s popular spot we saw room always capacity but could not hear my neighbour conversation time mentioned service just great gentleman warm personable with story dish and just enthusiastic always had way making u laugh with his super dry delivery and then hit you with infectious giggle end you had just smile back top being just great person talk had really wonderful way describe each dish clearly had passion and favourite we followed his suggestion and we rewarded with phenomenal night crispy chickpea fritter dinner kicked off with these crunchy fritter held tender and almost fluffy interior curry mayo pop flavour up with spice pickled onion cut through creamy curry with bright bold sweet and acidic kick just loved starter octopus salad their seasonal daily offering and think they should keep menu plating pretty but hiding under wreath endive you d find plumpest and crispy pork belly piece with perfectly charred tender octopus how could they get component perfectly crispy charred with still keeping everything supple and delicious tear into top those amazing thing they also had added element potato rosti crouton just really amazing crispy potato shred in cube form then they top off with delicious sauce cauliflower honey mustard you smokey meaty touch sweetness and kick spiced heat from mustard just great dish could eaten more charred beet simple vegetable elevated i m not sure how they made smokey but added flavour element kept from being boring salad smokiness reminded best smoked rib in bbq heavier char taste nicely contrasted by tangy smooth goat cheese and fresh herbal sauce end natural sweetness beet come through it s definitely one better beet preparation i ve had smoked duck breast with carrot done way think it cute but there s smiley face plate duck breast think it s very happy cooked fable cause another great dish particular duck done nicely medium rare had nice ruby shade inside juicy and had right gamey rich meat flavour go beyond your regular chicken accompaniment carrot interesting pureed creamy and naturally sweet roasted tender with good savour flavour from roasting almost taste like chicken fat pickled bright and punchy from vinegar and raw shredded nice crunch top there sharp caraway mustard seed sauce paired with another great dish could happily eat again rhubarb berry goat cheesecake point ready call quits but gentleman kind enough explain how delicious their dessert with word rhubarb and fresh berry uttered sold like light fresh tart and berry flavour perfect end creamy goat cheese cake nice base hazelnut praline praline good with it sweet crunchy nutty and wonderful flavour caramel cherry added gelee which wonderfully concentrated pop flavour you had tart rhubarb fresh blueberry added just in case you not enough fresh berry flavour already fable lot fan in vancouver and it s completely deserving best restaurant went during my trip and stand out with it s interesting use local ingredient and possibly one better service experience in definitely make reservation you won t sorry

food service environment place phenomenal from decor service food everything spectacular before we jump into food review want preface by describing how hungry we we had not eaten anything hour we ordered kimchi fried chicken and rutabaga tagliatelle ooomph wonderfully delicous fresh and perfect portion size combination ingredient compliment each very well we left feeling satiated and satisfied warm friendly service along with romantic farm table themed interior make great date spot but casual professional enough hold business oriented gathering keep up delicious food and spot service

our first stop our day trip in vancouver admit parking kind hard find try and get there early you can restaurant smaller than expected but still very accommodating food tasted great got try out their fish benedict right before they ran out and highly recommend

stopped by with few friend brunch somewhere wanted try out and heard good thing about first thing our server quite blunt and rude pretty much indirectly told my boyfriend fat and would need order dish had more food him continued make insulting comment him throughout meal not even remember what they because baffled i m not sure trying hit him funny anyways price are bit high what you get got scrambled egg with parmesan foam good but in smallest mason jar and portion small i m big eater but price and portion size not worth will not going back

came evening dinner treat myself sort adventure and fable not disappoint arrived party one mid week likely made seating easy food simply amazing they pulled off simple off menu garden salad much next table s surprise envy and had succulent smoked duck breast follow my server made sure had fantastic evening and needle say will holding them in high regard and back more

where one even begin say how amazing place not know how we lucky enough find place but we been visiting from chicago one week and nothing compared fable from coziness restaurant amazing wait staff and incredible food there nothing bad said about place we started with focaccia with delicious tomato jalape o butter incredible chickpea fritter and spaghetti duck meatball with parmesan foam and fantastic we especially loved curry mayonnaise sauce fritter we then had oyster mushroom pea gnocchi and salmon which they recommended medium rare everything outstanding we finished with s more dessert and lemon meringue with london fog ice cream best meal ever they change menu seasonally would fun visit frequently and sample new item they also great wine selection and use coravin and therefore large selection wine by glass

keywords daily special unique you can feel canadian vibe interior dark and place little loud presentation each dish very unique and visually pleasing recommend you go daily special because they never fail however you not want give go daily special duck breast steak and dessert are always smart choice

went brunch with friend and food ok nothing really special got steak and egg and my friend got egg benedict expecting my steak lot bigger only got few slice maybe g in total guess vancouver pricing ya service fine

wow we went dine out vancouver and place delicious not know what expect when reading menu lot menu item thing i ve never tried went due farm table concept and conveniently during dine out my appetizer chickpea fritter i ve never had chickpea but every bite amazing braised lamb entree delicious and tried bite seared ling cod which perfectly seared and hollandaise sauce paired well lastly we got lemon parfait and sticky date pudding desert and tasted great loved they in glass cup and perfect size u service great our server came by several time during dinner and asked u how our food despite how busy restaurant love restaurant and will definitely going back next time we re in vancouver

got just before am opening glad not many people in line however with limited seating inside not fooled into thinking not get busy by am almost full house fable known it brand straight from farm table with what offer from their menu fresh wholesome indeed we ordered benedict with oil hollandaise pulled pork johnny cake well side poached egg bacon had fish option with my benedict which comprised halibut cod scallop not forget add maple syrup bacon yummy found my benedict average tasting only because they probably healthiest i ve ever had i m more savory sweet tooth pile sugar type lol johnny cake amazing course poured whole lot maple syrup amazing dish overall brunch very satisfying you not feel uncomfortabley stuffed afterwards great atmosphere attentive service will try fable dinner one night

went brunch fable beautiful saturday morning and great time we seated immediately and our server kind and knowledgeable about menu brunch menu fairly small special interesting and food satisfying we ordered french toast and ham benedict former quite good fresh fruit and berry compote complemented sweetness bread nicely benedict also good though non traditional because olive oil based hollandaise we also had blueberry and orange juice mimosa overall good time reasonable price and nice atmosphere

thought coming pm would beat crowd but waitress said place full and would take least minute get table two we lucky two customer bar left earlier than expected we could take their place sitting bar pro and con fun having close up view chef making dish but proximity stove made my face hot and my clothes smell still food delicious and service excellent wonder good look prerequisite part service crew most staff dashing haha had risotto with pork belly every bite yummy dessert pretty lemon meringue with nice blend ice cream and cooky might too sour people but great next time i ll make reservation since they accept one

we just landed in vancouver and looked up best canadian restaurant open and lunch and fable came up what canadian food i m ready move duck meatball and spaghetti with parmesan foam literally changed my life it s rich but darn good i ve never ever had meatball crispy outside juicy and chewy inside can t stop thinking about pasta fresh and perfect well fritter light and flavorful great texture chickpea really difficult and chef nailed roasted beet salad had smoked cheese under what great twist beet salad that s many restaurant now loved subtle flavor grilled cheese sandwich they ran out bacon day we put pulled pork in ours pulled pork awesome ended up making bit too sweet texture perfect though and potato perfectly cooked tasted like sou vide and fried great welcome canada meal asian waitress super sweet and chef good looking said won cooking competition we picked perfectly thank you much awesome meal

before say anything our server night lisa deserves extra special mention wish there separate section give server rating deserves ten star out incredibly attentive despite how busy paid great attention detail food allergy very warm friendly and kind love her came with my closest friend special occasion day before my birthday made reservation month in advance and forgot during dine out time when we walked in extra loud and extra busy and they sat u tiny table really meant people there no way we going comfortable my friend kindly requested another table possible we quickly moved larger table where we had plenty room we very happy with how our server able fulfill request lisa very helpful with making recommendation cocktail suggested we might want add vodka gin non alcoholic beverage which not know option forgot name but got blueberry pomegranate drink with vodka like how they use organic juice and house made syrup ordered chickpea fritter which beautifully presented and had most delectable curry mayo should probably asked possible purchase buy jar by case could see myself putting everything also appreciated whenever lisa came with each course would explain element went into each dish highlighted each dish complex in it way with very well balanced flavour also just made feel kind fancy and special hear going eat something well made and delicious thank you taking time lisa my main course got mushroom cavatelli with side hour short rib add glad added short rib because creaminess mushroom sauce and savoury ness short rib perfect pairing had eat extra slow because not want saucey savour y party end desert got lemon meringue parfait which presented with lighted candle my birthday such nice surprise truly felt like birthday girl haha thought really nice special touch make my night much more memorable overall can see place get raving review about fine dining level cuisine and exceptionally memorable service thanks making my pre birthday dinner ah mayyyzzz ingg

we sat right away saturday brunch service good food came fast had best brunch caesar wish stuck with coffee had daily feature which sockeye salmon cake benny with beet relish not great relish too sweet boyfriend had pulled pork jimmy cake which not enjoy very much looking forward trying place awhile but underwhelmed not think we ll returning brunch anytime soon

they able accommodate our party easily their brunch menu very few option but able find something knew i d like ordered breakfast sandwich and replaced hash brown with side tomato basil soup soup wasn t best tasted very watery and def tasted like came out can breakfast sandwich however awesome thick cut bacon and egg large slice sourdough bread
fantastic place eat we stopped in brunch and not disappointed they farm table mentality which we love and staff are very helpful and friendly would return when in town

cant think single thing not love we ate tomato soup with grilled cheese chickpea fritter and egg benedict never had such simple food tasted complex our waitress i m unsure her name incredibly friendly and attentive them and we never moment left wanting would and will drive minute kitsalano just eat again

oh fable you are fab first timer today in wonderful restaurant my friend and sat bar which awesome we got see kitchen in action food looked and smelled delicious from what seeing in front u ordered fable muffin sausage cheese scrambled egg tomato and black pepper jam die my friend got most popular brunch item scrambled egg with parmesan foam looked absolutely divine and confirmed kitchen staff are damn calm not know how they such professional serving staff also delight chat with you can tell they too love product they serve and sell you re local visiting vancity must visit

my taste bud completely shocked by how amazing and tasteful every dish they serve chef know their stuff with many flavor going in each dish they complement each perfectly my friend and visiting from seattle two day and we came dinner those night never had such amazing food perfect you re going dinner you must get their roasted duck dish could not stop raving about how good their chickpea fritter are also amazing now go go go not hesitate and just go promise you wont disappointed
came surprise birthday dinner and fell in love with food reservation are recommended staff attentive and friendly one my favorite in vancouver must try you not
saw review yelp decided try it s pretty good not five star but definitely four we ordered benny and pasta and would say it s pretty pricy item taste good service good
always good time fable blacklight martini and amaretto sour are favorite well their fresh daily pasta it s excellent s more desert divine

service and food had one pasta die pork bolonese and gnocchi good but likely wouldn t get again foccacia good but i d skip though not my fave bread even best time though more dry side v moist like most foccacia
always great food and service when come fable been kit and broadway fable never disappoints

claude our server get tap first because made u welcome and service exemplary before we even tasted food dinner hand delicate and delicious we just about forgot everything else it s our third time fable and keep getting finer from appy dessert their ever changing menu many seasonal highlight

we went late valentine s day dinner my boyfriend and could not celebrate actual day start off making reservation extremely easy and there multiple time slot available friday evening not let fool you quite busy when we arrived and they squish you like sardine in their strategic floor plan when we first arrived we greeted by hostess and seated almost immediately it s restaurant smaller end and and table are close one another you literally bump elbow with guest sitting table next you however we not much issue because we got enjoyment listening our neighbor s conversation which you cannot avoid since you re right next them not sure explainable but decor farm table decor well food please keep in mind they change their menu seasonally and what their website not match menu they had evening not bother u much considering we still enjoyed our food we ordered glazed pork rib cavatelli canned tuna charred beet chef s special green with blue berry vinaigrette and lemon meringue dessert glazed pork rib came with about pound very good portion tender juicy meat seasoning point and had asian flair my favorite dish evening cavatelli you can tell pasta hand made and best quality saltier side but we loved mushroom tender and great flavor canned tuna marketed their best selling dish bit too oily our liking but still had great flavor charred beet absolutely loved beet had nice smokey flavor from charring almond added very sweet crunch and cheese paired very well chef green special highly recommend not getting green small bowl mixed green with dressing tasted like something you buy off sale rack grocery store very bland and dry not worth something dollar we ended up adding our beet salad just give more flavor lemon meringue earl grey icecream best part dessert could care le about lemon aspect highly recommend just ordering ice cream in could would give fable instead due lack urgency from wait staff we had call our waitress every time and even once had order from different server

fantastic spot bite eat hollondaise sauce egg benny die cozy homey atmosphere with fairly small local selection make place absolute gem wait food can little bit high you arrive opening but quality food more than male up

friend and stopped by thursday afternoon had heard good thing and being general fan kit area decided finally check out concept fable great farm table no worrying about sketchy veggie distributor and knowing exactly where your food from we sat immediately and greeted warmly by our waiter explained menu and seemed genuinely interested in how we doing day asking about our study and what we enjoyed doing in our free time great alternative usual server customer small talk made our experience feel really genuine ordered pasta day mealshare always try order when see restaurant and they they get automatic star pesto tagliatelle with turkey chorizo flavour mixed together well delicious my friend got grilled cheese my pasta great but her sandwich truly something else only had bite but i d say probably best grilled cheese ever had onion jam though wow definitely check place out you re in mood comfort food
delicious outstanding inventive food very attentive and well informed staff definitely would recommend

excellent dining experience no fuss quick service small menu knowledgeable and very attentive staff and food we started with cornbread with special flavoured butter which moist and addictive then came canned tuna institutional landmark dish with good reason flavourful and rich but never cloying then we had scallop and pork belly and special night seated need heart in black pepper jelly cooked and seasoned perfection and came with nice refreshing salad counterbalance umami and richness finished with shared dessert poached rhubarb with ginger cake custard and lavender ice cream we stuffed and happily would return in heartbeat and recommend friend overall our meal came just over no drink but completely worth

beautifully and creatively plated food isn t dainty you finish your dish hungry brunch highly recommend scrambled egg which come in mason jar and creamy and delicious house made brioche jam and ketchup give dish extra point dinner onion gnocchi divine plump piece dense gnocchi mop up creamy soubise and pesto sauce like work magic roasted veggie balance out dish in texture and esthetic add tender pulled pork and you ve got yourself real winner dessert would advise against lemon meringue parfait meringue much much too sweet even my sweet tooth bottom line would come back brunch and dinner

came dine out and excited finally chance eat service fine presentation food great but sadly not find enjoyed food much least option personally ordered like what my friend got since we had party three we able try almost dine out item got good range what they offer only thing we not lamb shoulder appetizer wise got chickpea fritter upon our server s recommendation but found them way too salty green top nicely seasoned crunchy and fresh though which nice contrast fritter themselves though found my friend s roasted squash salad much more my liking though sometimes contrast in flavor not quite meld felt wanting entree got paella again waaay too salty bit oily seafood little overcooked and flavor bit too acidic maybe due tomato everything cooked just fine and portion size good though my friend s mushroom cavatelli with short rib very tasty though wish had gotten instead basically licked her plate clean would too haha dessert got lemon meringue parfait ok top tasted more like burnt marshmellow than light meringue lemon curd nice but only couple small spoonful worth and there few tiny cookie bit in there well but i m pretty sure they forgot ice cream sad but definitely liked squash cake my friend got much much better presentation fun there good contrast flavor texture and just really good drink wise got wake up bit too sour and my friend got drink but wasn t my fav either overall i m glad finally got see what fable about and dine out gave great chance admittedly expecting much more especially from what i ve heard about service and food neither which particularly impressed by but still good time with good friend

fable solid dining option but dish pale in comparison farm table option such farmer s apprentice forage and oakwood bistro spinach egg benedict wasn t fan overly tangy hollandaise sauce dish miss cavatelli with mushroom flavor good but portion very small wouldn t mind paying quality pasta but dish not justify price tag we also opted add pork belly but kitchen forgot add meat initially and then they brought pork belly over separately different plate pork belly not add dish

during our trip vancouver hoping dinner embodied canadian vancouver cuisine which chose eat appreciate their emphasis farm table and using local ingredient highlight region s resource place narrow and feel bit crowded but really like because warm and cozy feel also service great most importantly food great price are little high and people might think portion are small but think entree are big enough leave you feeling satisfied without feeling too full and price reasonable quality one thing really like about each dish everything plate add dish whole rather than adding anything afterthought filler every veggie and sauce contributes dish enjoyed sauce much made sure sop up much possible with each and every bite we started off with appetizer chickpea fritter and tagliatelle and meatball fritter and meatball slightly denser than expected but still moist enough and tasty loved tangy curried mayo and pea shoot fritter and app parmesan foam light and had strong parmesan flavor though suggest eating foam quickly before dissolve tagliatelle had good chew too we shared entree smoked duck butcher s cut beef chuck wild bc salmon and gnocchi with pulled pork loved sweet smokey flavor duck just wish le chewy and skin more crispy few bit crispy skin great they great job lightly cooking salmon because rare in middle but cooked enough moist and very easy cut through would ve liked more seasoning salmon but risotto like barley and toasted pumpkin seed delicious pulled pork seemed like strange pairing with gnocchi and very sweet but really liked mushroom and onion sauce really good gnocchi gnocchi are like really large long pillow creamy potato perfect soaking up delicious oniony sauce butcher s cut day chuck roast sou vided hour only came with chunk meat but meat absolutely tender and thick dark jam smeared onto plate sweet and incredible small block potato great too because it s crispy outside and creamy inside finally we finished our meal with smores burnt marshmallow topping pretty much tasted like smores and great bite marshmallow ice cream and crunchy cookie once however dessert very sweet and not seem innovative everything else we had it s not must order overall our dinner fantastic and really feel like got taste what vancouver offer value good in term price versus quality and each dish seems very carefully thought out and put together highlight night curried mayo from fritter app barley risotto and pumpkin seed from salmon dish onion sauce with gnocchi and thick sweet sauce chuck roast plate

my rating fable farm table nice restaurant name got excited when saw high rating yelp but after my visit felt like slightly overrated best canned tuna diced tuna topped with layer potato puree and olive oil which you mix together in jar and spread toasted brioche like texture it s smooth spread but still chunk tuna giving chewiness tasted slightly creamy but lacked bit flavor interesting but wasn t much my liking and overpriced what you get spaghetti and meatball giant duck meat ball served with tagliatelle and mushroom topped with parmesan whip parmesan whip amazing really creamy and strong in cheese flavor mixed really well with pasta flavor waiter mentioned when you cut duck meat ball juice would burst out which not really happen slightly disappointed meat slightly dry not moist thought would onion gnocchi added pulled pork pan seared gnocchi with burnt onion and fresh mixed vegetable topped with pulled pork pulled pork meat soft and tender but felt like sauce not blend too well with gnocchi gnocchi piece thick dense but soft and creamy and tasted great with pesto sauce flavor point loved fresh ingredient in dish tomato vegetable green really tasty and delicious not get wrong food delicious really like decor and atmosphere place service great too

i d like give star rating plz yelp plz came with bae wednesday night celebrate special occasion immediately upon entry our server unbelievably friendly upbeat relatable generous and attentive u truly defined excellence when come providing service not know what her name but had very light blond hair cut in short bob plz congratulate her gave u immediately glowing first impression easy decide what order once saw pesto and gnocchi in sentence our server confirmed indeed her favourite dish well and made more excited when come out and came out very quickly there not too much anticipation thankfully once plate touched onto our table ogled i ve seen beautiful plating like master chef but never before my eye like beautiful colourful textured garden filled with zucchini tomato sprout pesto gnocchi and beautiful caramel coloured onion glaze tasted even better swear my eye watered when first bit into heaven gnocchi unlike gnocchi ever had before they larger than most and they had fluffy texture instead being dense literally like biting into little fluffy perfect pillow heaven pesto sauce subtle but complemented onion glaze perfectly which slightly sweet but had roasted component pesto sauce also complemented roasted vegetable perfectly well wow my mouth watering just thinking about meal truly life changing experience and then we had dessert and died we ordered s more dessert which had crumbled brownie bit chocolate ice cream caramel and toasted lemon and marshmallow meringue top there every kind taste and texture imaginable in sweet salty sour chewy crunchy soft everything worked well together orchestra flavour leaving place felt satisfied physical and emotional level felt nourished cared respected adored in nutshell felt like million dollar want come back time want cry every meal want melt into my food not even know what am saying anymore their food good make you nonsensical and yes cap lock necessary

came famous vancouver eatery my dad s birthday tonight and we extremely pleased with food and entire experience family four we started with appetizer first being canned tuna which really exceeded my expectation actually hate canned tuna but after mashing up little jar deliciousness no idea what contains and spread light toast refreshing and tasty also spaghetti and meatball featured nice and meaty ball with perfectly al dente pasta with creamy and cheesy sauce last we tried their feature which pork croquette which nicely fried and tasty also came with salad green featuring their nod local and in season our entree ordered potato gnocchi with brown butter onion and added pulled pork oh my goodness dish heavy decadent and absolutely scrumptious sauce perfectly flavoured with savoury component made you going back more gnocchi pillowy soft and pulled pork tender and quite good portion also got taste duck breast dish my mom ordered and best part definitely pea sitting upon they extremely fresh and sweet in way canned pea never are and duck very nicely cooked my dad really enjoyed his pork and scallop dish well saying clam very fresh and sauce decadent but tasty finally my brother got butcher cut behind cow s leg sorry forgot name cooked hour making once lean meat very tender his dish also came with many green and nicely fried up potato overall meal extremely delicious we loved thing we ordered and though sauce and side really made meal amazing price are also reasonable food we got and dish very well portioned keep u full would recommend

we called and tried make reservation dinner but they unfortunately booked and told we can show up when they open pm and just walk in because good review we took our chance and showed up pm there small line up but we managed get table and informed by polite receptionist we can stay til pm which long enough finish our meal place really nice and cozy it s bit small but well designed and clean lighting good too our server very friendly and gave u brief orientation what restaurant about followed by introduction their dinner special and few suggestion well very attentive despite how busy place we got foie gras and octopus salad start foie gras came in mason jar with sort apple jam and duck skin crumble top also served with few piece bread really delicious octopus salad star had light char and went very well with bacon and hummus just simply explosion great flavour main we got flat iron steak and butcher s cut meat perfectly cooked and served with green mushroom and black pepperjam sauce also tried their cocktail called kiss from rose which light and refreshing unfortunately we had no room dessert but should not long our next visit what excellent dining experience will definitely come back more

fresh rich flavorful succulent memorable you enter and walk past cook line sit small natural wood table in dark warm ambiance relaxed knowledgeable staff are attentive every menu item had unique clever ingredient like my cocktail with cranberry basil elderberry and vodka cod cheek appetizer flavorful and nicely paired with tasty marinade and picked onion and butter lettuce perfect combination flavor and texture main course gnocchi with pulled pork and wonderful array rich and colorful vegetable sampled duck too which beautifully smoky not fatty and had rich tasty hollandaise duck better dish two but wonderful

delicious farm table food with fresh seasonal ingredient decent portion size and reasonable price one my favorite restaurant recent trip in vancouver and i d definitely recommend and also would come back again come with people you can order few plate share we started out with cornbread piece which came out warm and good but not absolute must bit fluffier side almost more like cake i ve had cornbread blow out water would pas and save room something else off menu chickpea fritter there little fritter which delicious with curry mayo pickled onion and green they not skimp topping and fritter paired really well with curry flavor you not like curry you ll want skip dish since it s pretty spice intensive really liked and easy share ling cod also delicious with homemade duck sausage and squash puree fish fresh and flaky you like white fish you ll like dish onion gnocchi there s option add pulled pork and waiter nice enough let u add sou vide stiletto steak instead we could try i m sure pulled pork would equally delicious since you can t go wrong with pulled pork gnocchi one best i ve had fluffy and everything good gnocchi should with onion and pesto everyone enjoyed every bite smoked duck breast not usually love duck much but done right smoky but not salty with sweet apple puree and quinoa paired perfectly with would order again in heartbeat everything really delicious fresh and unique i d come back again dinner try more their dish good number people come with since appetizer and main are not quite big enough shared with party larger than we not get dessert because we went next door rain shine they close pm make reservation ahead time place can get busy we able get last minute reservation sunday night by calling in during afternoon plan ahead i m sure friday and saturday night are crazy i d love come back again

intense flavor fantastic presentation cool vibe came dinner weeknight and place moderately filled staff friendly and straight forward wasn t sure what wanted eat and my waiter very good describing menu concise ended up getting sold special night spotted shrimp with thick piece bacon along with fixing aroma dish made melt in my seat flavor blended together well they controlled bacon awesomeness wouldn t overpower ingredient will return then next time i m in vancouver

excellent food went dinner had mushroom gnocchi and perfect except added bacon pancetta and crazy thick cuz block bacon which delicious but little overwhelming loved staff had french waiter super informative and kept cracking corny joke but really brightened up our dinner place dark and intimate nice romantic evening but just went with friend cocktail solid well but not groundbreaking anyway will def return can really liked my experience

love new american cuisine during my recent trip vancouver had see what new canadian food about and am glad tried fable everything cooked deliciously ingredient balanced with richness and freshness service great and dinner priced reasonably we made reservation friday night and hostess informed u we had out within hour little confused because i m typically quick eater once food hit table snap my photo and then food in my belly dining experience enjoyable not even realize we there almost hour menu isn t very extensive maybe about dish total appetizer entree and dessert there also prix fixe menu just lot cocktail choose from no whiskey only gin and vodka and also non alcoholic mocktails people we pretty much ordered half menu option enjoyed every dish and overly stuffed here s run my favorite dish canned tuna house cured tuna in jar with herb potato and oil it s mashed together and spread crusty bread must try you enjoy cured meat like tomato soup paired perfectly with onion grilled cheese sandwich sammie served shallow bowl and soup poured table from tea pot soup nice and thick but not overly acidic butcher s cut special evening sou vide chuck steak hour there only two slice steak cut very thick wish there more steak super tender and paired perfectly with black pepper jam little kick shiitake mushroom and bok choy roasted duck two such hearty meal with crispy brussels sprout lentil and spicy chorizo and broccolini duck skin sweet and crispy and meat tender we could comb out with just fork s more texture homemade brownie good balance crispy like edge and soft like cake portion wasn t overly rich from brownie and chocolate ice cream and meringue soft and creamy lemon parfait too sour but enjoyed london fog ice cream and streusel crunch dish probably could done without rustic loaf with garlic and parmesan butter butter wasn t garlicky cheesy enough and duck meatball nothing special highly recommend give fable try

we very excited come breakfast lunch dinner just looked great we opted dinner dining room busy noisy and cramped tuesday evening around oh well it s popular drink good house focaccia with roasted black pepper butter standout we each ordered appetizer and entree big mistake more later first course beet and burrata and octopus guess we weren t expecting these overly salad y but they and they pretty big like dinner salad load green very tasty then came main pea gnocchi with bacon my wife and scallop and pork belly gnocchi in quote because these aren t gnocchi they re more like big british dumpling bacon and pork belly are in quote because they thing in each dish exact thing far we could tell wasn t problem u we love big chunk fried pork belly bacon just weird they called two different thing maybe one smoked and wasn t but smoking not work main also loaded with green heavy crisp lightly cooked garden green like kale mustard green etc they delicious but man oh man someone should warn people they might good with just first second course maybe two first and entree share serious green overload normally i m begging find good green traveling they are definitely just know they re in large quantity service wasn t spectacular little rushed but busy i d try place again but maybe breakfast instead

one best place i ve been in ever think food fresh flavourful fun ironically not like canned tuna much what saw from review my favourite thing ate there actually daily soup and bread tangy creamy tomato soup and perfectly toasted and buttered crisp sourdough just perfect also liked tuna ni oise salad and platter well their hash brown are very unique staff are very friendly and welcoming had great experience anyway place must try

my friend and saw high rating and just give restaurant try definitely lived up it rating right from start restaurant very beautifully decorated and server very nice and attentive food absolutely amazing everything farm table and could really taste freshness ingredient top taste presentation excellent and everything carefully plated ordered mushroom polenta very tempted order breakfast served in mason jar just because beautiful look but i m such huge fan polenta polenta very creamy with almost soup like texture very rich and delicious and they weren t stingy with mushroom poached egg in middle really completed meal excellent eatery with very high quality food thank you

place really average food tasty service great and ambiance cozy but portion size puny my husband got spaghetti and meatball absolutely delicious but wish portion size bigger you get small bowl pasta with white sauce and one pretty dinky meatball duck meatball good not usually like eating duck but my goodness not know how you make duck taste freaking good when they said dish came with one meatball had expected meatball little smaller than my fist nope i d say probably little bigger than circumference canadian two dollar coin also ordered duck parfait i m not usually fan duck liver not try ordered chicken with risotto chicken very tender but not really like sauce went with risotto wasn t best i ve had really enjoyed eating tiny carrot reason they tasty our total bill about service great our waitress attentive and helpful in giving u tip what order they make very yummy food but set your expectation portion size small

fable fabulous z five star farm table homemade gourmet presentation taste service ambiance everything perfect we sat kitchen bar and watched chef create their art wanted try everything came out from kitchen looked good came saturday very busy but not feel rushed service very friendly and informative egg benny with halibut awesome blueberry smoothie good could more coming back dinner stay fabulous

arguably there aren t many good story come out tv reality show fable kitchen isn t one those story not let restaurant s small space it small menu fool you heavyweight competing with best restaurant across town restaurant with small menu always catch my attention take healthy dose confidence present small selection each night and still keep your patron happy i m sure you ll very happy after your meal service top notch employee treat you good friend they accomplish in middle packed and loud floor you wish more restaurant treated it customer like not with pretentiousness but with soothing professional and warm attitude i m told menu change lot based what s fresh i ll leave you with save room oops dropped dessert

really nice inside not really what expecting very well staffed with high turn over menu bit small but food good their spaghetti and meatball appy amazing think they should creat entree version my bf doubled appetizer entree size but then seemed little high priced way their vegetarian pasta which tasty fritter are really good but bit too much mayo my liking would go back give try

we went with big party expecting great food and great service based past experience and review we got breakfast went wrong every turn we almost first party sit and dish we ordered sold out our order skipped over multiple time people sat after u paid and leaving before we got food one staff kept telling u our food moment away when clearly wasn t and then one order wrong everyone restaurant very nice about but many thing went wrong they just wrote u off they could focusing salvaging people s morning food pretty ok not ever figure out what people think special about place it s good enough diner breakfast in good location maybe lunch dinner more special we probably won t going back find out staff cool and nice with clientele but skip

one best breakfast i ve had in restaurant had pulled pork johnny cake and wife tried meatball skillet very unique flavor combination and delicious even child s big breakfast had sophisticated flavor and presentation we re eager return

just add my yum vote crowd my daughter and finally stopped by lunch and fantastic from chick pea fritter appetizer s more sundae dessert we pleased place thoroughly engages you from conscientious wait staff variety flavour every plate case in point sandwich ate wasn t totally my cup tea but well constructed and lovingly made must fault my palette before blame kitchen ate sandwich analyzing every bite complex tasting though had few ingredient we charmed by wait staff coming table tell u our orange juice had not arrived yet essentially it way from farm think my daughter loved little cup juice more than based thought coming from farm especially her that s lovely recommend you re budget conscious consider lunch wasn t cheap but not nearly steep dinner

star service really not feel food too great ordered scrambled egg and came in tiny jar topped with melted cheese there much cheese looked like yogurt seems very experimental asked could order something else and they obliged and even sped up my food appreciate excellent service there egg benny ended up with ok but nothing special unfortunately not think food really anything special but again service fantastic

thank you yelp helping find fable not enough good thing say about my meal others reviewer aren t kidding when they talk about how great restaurant bit worried about getting table came early hostess extremely nice and got seated right away my waitress immediately fun friendly and engaging making meal much more enjoyable had great suggestion but never pushy wasn t going cocktail but my seat had view bar and bartender looked like man knew what about ordered amaretto sour made with vancouver amaretto and bourbon wow one best cocktail i ve ever tasted saw lot review canned tuna and had give try wasn t disappointed combination flavour in mason jar amazing and went nicely toast crisp great size too my entree had gnocchi with onion and honestly best prepared gnocchi i ve ever had in my life wanted lick plate when done gnocchi seared nicely add little crisp and sou vide onion mouthwatering not usually get dessert but when dinner good really could not stop myself from ordering s more again in mason jar with seared marshmallow top chocolate ice cream in middle created nice temperature change really added taste bottom layer bit too chocolately but bet true chocoholics would go nut i ll coming back fable every chance get

such modern yet cozy place ordered smoked duck breast dish medium well and best duck dish i ve ever had wasn t grainy nor chewy no duck smell either ingredient in dish went well together and very flavorful and well balanced together only thing thought could ve been better duck little jucier more moist overall service food and atmosphere amazing

love place staple must go you re spending day in kitsilano and staple local too love use local produce their menu seasonal not been dinner yet but been lunch handful time and highly recommend their lunch menu tasty and affordable my husband love their fable burger with lot cheddar bacon and mushroom best burger he s had in vancouver yet big call know hand tried something different menu every time today had crispy rock fish with thai salad w sambal very delicious my only gripe they heaped thai salad top my crispy fish which made my fish soggy they also promised fry with burger today instead we got wedge i m not big fan wedge and love fry but also not mislead your customer than server great and atmosphere pleasant quiet and comfortable

first time restaurant last night absolutely great food and service love fresh ingredient and combination flavor yet still taste hint individual true taste would like go back again and also try breakfast

reviewing food only i d given star but service exceptional fable earns star dineout vancouver there fixed course menu got squash salad roasted acorn and spaghetti squash green w housemade ricotta and my husband got fried chickpea fritter w curry mayo okay nothing earth shattering will say though portion course large end main course got mushroom cavatelli had good flavor but salty could not eat way too heavy handed w salt my husband got paella which also good but spicy and we love spice also hard finish dessert good but we pretty full by time they got there we only had little each my hub had lemon meringue very tasty and had crumble rum cake topped w egg nog ice cream and mascarpone cream super rich but delicious
we always try stop in when we re in town love seasonal menu and fresh ingredient staff are friendly and attentive food always great

my friend and not disappointed in our choice tonight dinner we decided last minute dine fable called ahead ass chance getting table pm hostess phone nice enough say it s busy but had room bar now and table will come available in min we decided try either option luckily bar spot still available when we got there we truly enjoyed our spot bar by serving station not too sure would like being in seat by door though too many people standing behind you waiting their seat anyhow we enjoyed watching chef expediting order and not being crowded by diner around u we started off with canned tuna recommended by reviewer we truly enjoyed warned it small portion great you aren t sharing suggest not sharing cause it good my friend had gnocchi with pulled pork and had duck great choice encouraged my friend not like duck try my duck pleasantly surprised how lean they ve done great job trimming away fat and left tasty medium rare meat plate my friend s gnocchi hearty and full flavour stuffed and had take rest home with bottle and half litre wine with our meal we stuffed and unfortunately not room dessert even though what we saw liked delicious service attentive not pretentious one reviewer also noted atmosphere relax and also noticed diner taking time thank staff great meal fable definite must try

loved every aspect dining fable from service friendly knowledgeable and helpful wait staff ambiance food had tomato soup first course which came with mini grilled cheese sandwich in center bowl i m not normally creamy soup fan but in combination with sandwich and warm bread bun dipping great highlight entree gnocchi onion with pulled pork one best dish i ve ever had interesting mixture flavor and everything cooked and seasoned perfectly my girlfriend had salmon which great in it right but could not stop picking gnocchi off my plate dessert we had oops dropped dessert upside waffle cone simulating unfortunate ice cream accident we hoping more rhubarb since featured in description but focused blueberry ice cream and relegated rhubarb paste side still not disappoint and finished off amazing meal u highly recommend fable anyone looking creative dish in upscale but not stuffy environment

highly recommended great and friendly service food amazing we ve tried almost everything their menu and everything fantastic

fable restaurant i ve wanted try mostly because their chef s fame from competing in top chef canada and their emphasis fresh dish farm table fable dinner service start pm by time we arrived just before pm table already filled reserved we grabbed seat by bar facing open kitchen before those taken up too come early we had fantastic server not catch her name had ton energy and made everything sound delicious had originally decided what get but convinced try out their special instead we shared appetizer entree and two dessert per server s recommendation we had canned tuna which amazing sou vide tuna in mason jar rib eye steak which special and included lobster perogies and brocollini blueberry lavender tart and their daily sweet bite which included two piece sort almond cake espresso macaroon and chocolate brownie everything delicious canned tuna unique dish and may not hit with everyone loved rib eye and lobster perogies came with just amazing preferred blueberry lavender tart over sweet bite fantastic buttermilk icecream tart price not overly expensive yet time not cheap great food great atmosphere and fantastic service lot fun being able see chef cook out in open even though bar seat pretty warm because proximity kitchen you re planning going definitely make reservation
