fable great local and sustainable food with season dish they are sure blow you away with their freshness and creativity you are into food snag seat bar and watch them create then you can see every dish before you order staff including cook are super friendly well sure make reservation table you re going during busy time brunch my favorite dish gnocchi with pulled pork and seasonal preparation best gnocchi i ve had

prix fixe menu amazing every mouthful flavorful and satisfying also order joie muscat and pair with canned tuna die i ve been pairing wine yr and among best i ve tasted had pork croquette ahi tuna apple sauce fennel confit and radish slaw and wrapped up with savarin soaked with rum and served with hard sauce delicious my wife had cauliflower soup risotto and gorgonzola cheesecake marscapone and preserved fruit also amazing cheesecake almost too much blue cheese you took accompaniment then perfect

yes watched top chef canada season i d been hearing hype and liked farm table concept we went with super high expectation but just disappointed we ordered drink and two appy special which believe seared scallop w black bean sauce and pork croquette they came and visually appealing but teeeeeny tiny could ve stuffed three croquette in my mouth granted after not too shabby but puny appy s we still pretty hungry our entree potato crusted chicken and butternut squash gnocchi gnocchi butternut squash hazelnut oyster mushroom swiss chard many delicious ingredient in one plate but only ok definitely had better but what bothered portion size think there maybe little piece gnocchi my plate chicken came little fried log bed ratatouille seriously underseasoned and fried potato coating reminded like bad fried chinese takeout food obviously we skipped dessert and had eat dinner again later best thing about fable server attentive and friendly another thing really bothered layout it s open kitchen you walk by when you enter dining area in back however pantry fridge in back there constantly people walking back and forth carrying arm full cabbage and meat and seafood it s super awkward

happy say my th review s service impeccable accommodating thorough engaging willing spend time describing item and just sweet friendly and ball canned tuna not sound appealing u but came highly recommended by friend and delicious key mix up really well then top toast provided reminiscent tuna sashimi but cooked but not hard like canned tuna you re thinking smooth silky fresh just try pepper jam with steak scrumptious large perfectly cooked portion kale with trout very good scallop and bacon also great personal preference not care cauliflower velout dessert are truly high calibre well thought out perfectly executed and fresh really really good we found wine list not extensive but well thought out with fair mix expensive and reasonable wine thanks jody b your review really eliminate my scrolling time

wanted try awhile and definitely worth had imagined pricey place but actually really affordable w great choice ingredient are from local farm and business and exactly like it title from farm table service great waiter and hostess very attentive and great they knew their menu and food really well everyone very professional would say you sit in table in middle two people then really small unless you are guy w no coat and bag otherwise you are reserving two people only then ask table side more room area and your neighbour aren t playing footsie charisy with you food really great highly recommend canned tuna divine always wonder what canned tuna doing menu but great can t wait compare canned tuna fable hard beat would say think beautiful sunny day running in meadow daffodil in your mouth really scrumptious and delicious also had feature day mushroom oatmeal w escargot yummy and rich would ask bread go w cracker but not salty it just yummy you want savour every last bite delicious share really great main we had flatiron steak and halibut well would say bit disappointed w flatiron steak dish steak great and tender enough guilan and onion bit burned and charred not most enjoyable which bit letdown given rest amazingness my friend s halibut divine and melted in your mouth definitely will order next time dessert amazing s more looked delicious and make you want back campire w story and blanket around you strawberry shortcake parfait perfect make you feel like little girl w big icecream and berry and spoon w pretty bowl just classic giddiness even guy will love highly recommend fable would try their duck and fish dish main next time
finally place where can get egg benedict with real hollandaise and not busy you come in before service good music pleasant and not loud enjoyed my meal and will back sure
just ok we looking brunch place with new canadian fare and none u blown away not come hungry either because portion are thr smaller side

still fantastic suggest sitting bar overlooking kitchen get sneak peak food being prepared very knowledgeable service especially detailed explanation cooking technique and ingredient clearly professional dedicated staff help you make most out your experience sommelier very happy come over and help u with wine list surprisingly extensive smaller casual place and helped u choose wine complimented our meal apparently they use inert gas contraption draw wine out bottle with needle wine never go off and each glass fresh newly opened one duck meatball highlight our night not put off by odd presentation from moment we walked in door and greeted warmly having door held u we left stellar dining experience

visited place last week during lunch nice weather but completely swamped with people lunch took more than hour which downside otherwise food decent wanted order burger but sold out big disappointment hence ordered vegetarian pasta with chorizo added tasted like cream pesto pasta which good but nothing crazy liked overall ambience but service relatively slow my brother had egg benedict which average will return again but hope they would stock enough burger next time

food tasted amazingly fresh had egg benedict with ham along with pulled pork johnny cake hollandaise sauce not overpowering with lemon juice which pulled in subtle flavor delicious ham usually not like savory and sweet dish but johnny cake exception loved pulled pork and jalape o stuffed in pancake and flavorful not even need add maple syrup service exceptional and waitress there patient with our big group would definitely come back
yummy had gnocchi and salad perfectly plated and taste subtle magic staff attentive and not miss beat except refill drink order easy casual ambiance happy go you re in kit and need bite

they serve one most creamiest tomato soup i ve had egg benedict delicious ours came with english muffin and pulled pork enjoyed side potato cake and salad dressing sweet and flavourful excellent customer service

could not think negative thing say about fable truly masterful dinner with creative and well executed dish service great well fable now my must go back list loved potato gnocchi one best vegetarian dish i ve had in long time beautiful plate food in every sense lemon meringue parfait mind blowing

nice i m veggie and often farm table place menu very animal protein heavy with sparse vegetarian offering not had hard time making up my mind sampled few appetizer squash blossom best barrata also very good chickpea fritter good but not great first too had pea gnocchi main yummy and generousness portion i m sucker cheese plate and they nice one subtle blue comox brie and something sharp i ve forgotten but nice they paired well and sett off by lovely assortment toast walnut and sweetness lived closer they d in my regular rotation place

quality food pretty good nice environment and ok come with small group friend

went dineout dinner menu serving very small and neither my friend full end had lingcod which little dry and rather bland sat back under electronic screen which would hit our head we leaned back too far dessert good though probably wouldn t come back

happy finally got check out fable am big fan top chef series and heard lot positive comment about fable set up neat with open kitchen right when you walk in my friend and sat dining area which further back next time i ll grab seat right kitchen can watch chef cook stand out food item we had definitely canned tuna and house bread special cornbread had gnocchi entree which good although prefer having them pan seared instead my friend liked her flat iron steak which came with delicious potato fondant will definitely come back fable again with friend try thing menu

love concept and execution starter little underwhelming but entree knocked out park they are seemingly famous their canned tuna needed bit acid and crunch wouldn t get again signature cocktail weren t great but beer selection service amazing

first time went fable anniversary with my boyfriend which reserved out good recommendation we greeted door and right away taken our seat we impressed with host and server s friendliness and how they acknowledged our anniversary and our food restriction am vegetarian we ordered drink and started with chickpea fritter and salad they had time and we completely blown away by chickpea fritter curried sauce unbelievable came in bottle would definitely put everything our main course ordered seared fish and order butternut squash pesto gnocchi one bite in and we in awe traveled italy and had lot gnocchi but gnocchi hand best ever tried they like little soft pillow melted away in my mouth perfect texture and consistency my boyfriend raved about fish dish well full course meal fable can pricey side well worth we agreed fable our favourite restaurant in vancouver and made our official monthly anniversary dinner place we been going there past month and last time phoned make reservation they recognized asking and your wife vegetarian yes which suggests how impressive their service high quality service combined with high quality ingredient and dish make fable not only place eat but experience each month we anticipate what menu will consist and what type gnocchi dish will devouring we thank fable having u each month and providing consistently beautiful experience
very very tasty amazing meld flavor steak and potato and asparagus yum great service almost bit too attentive we counted least different people attended our table i d definitely visit again

it s important preface with fact refuel one my favourite spot and upset when they closed i d heard new place opening but thought myself they re never going beat refuel right well turn out wrong fable awesome brunch club sat they took reservation which worth star in it s right saturday brunch in vancouver waiter super casual but extremely cool ordered fable egg with sausage side egg sunny side up my favourite cooked perfection top lardons potato and tomato jam yes tomato jam friggin delicious jam there few u could not decide whether order sausage side just get farmer breakfast sandwich important note isn t menu but asked and it s going soon sausage by waiter just told u order sausage because it d cheaper and comped u sandwich which we cut up and shared amazing and sausage probably best one i ve had brunch in vancouver in year maybe ever made from pig they had delivered dinner special earlier in week lovely flavor with nice finish spice amazing say already too bad in not complaint about fable you should probably go there before everyone else find them and they get crazy busy and order sausage

hour later i m still thinking about how good food love concept every thing fresh from farm and delicious you can taste freshness ingredient and flavor also abundant we went there lunch and lunch menu although limited varied enough accommodate meat lover and vegetarian they also not seem mind modifying ingredient make them work you price range from lunch sandwich and it s enough o fill you up delicious fresh food great price reason will definitely returning place again maybe brunch next time

omg just wasn t expecting love much and even more than found great value unlike many fine dining establishment in vancouver place wasn t vibe fine dining but food definitely i m reality tv show junkie and top chef usa my fave show them watch much reality show barely remember anyone after show end only thing could tell my friend remembered trevor finished nd and think liked him not even remember won read re cap final last night when got home and remembered wanted trevor win i d watch over positive though anyway when we walked in trevor greeted u and turned into star struck idiot said hello and asked u how we and froze and put goofy smile and said hi trevor you would had see know how goofy looked i m still embarrassed and wished would said hi chef trevor also saw trista and remembered not like her though told my friend her name trisha can t remember not like her but know not food good everything balanced perfectly in flavour and texture in bliss highlight special beef cheek full point after three appies but finished first time tried salsify too what awesome dish love root veggie dish perfect choice my friend had potato crusted chicken which said had never had chicken tender before we had canned tuna duck meatball and special top chef carl s winner charcuterie my friend s fave evening duck meatball excellent and pricing even better with great friendly service made star meal raved everyone work today and another co worker and will going in two week want try everything there restaurant yum what pleasant experience

one my favorite restaurant in vancouver food unbelievably delicious and service always been great though you ll likely wait long time table you not reserve

ventured out fable saturday night with few friend wasn t expecting much because th really not much offer in term really good food well well pleasantly surprised our group started with canned tuna star crispy and raw spot prawn star mushroom flatbread star bread nearly impossible cut through sawmill creek oyster star our main flat iron steak served with brocollini and potato star duck served with scallion perogie green bean and cauliflower x star fairy bland halibut with chorizo sausage gnocchi in cream sauce with medley veggie star we downed two bottle wine french pinot noir and bc pinot gris u our bill came tip and tax included can t wait go back and try more food
excellent love concept decor and food please open location in yaletown

can t believe forgotten write review great place in kit been numerous time appies dinner and time dessert decor minimalist that s not give place star view from bar amazing though highly recommend sitting bar get glimpse what running restaurant busy night like our server friendly but little bit pushy with number time dropped by like relaxed vibe joint way more relaxed than anywhere downtown let s get dessert we tried lemon meringue parfait and cheese plate parfait many layer and combination sour crumbly and sweet flavour must try cheese plate bit dull selection wasn t special overall when in kitsilano you give fable try you ll glad you

definitely two thumb up it s been my radar and especially since seeing great yelp review out far food definitely from farm table and you can taste how fresh from first bite first they wonderful service server are extremely friendly patient and know how deal with kid we saw table next u we ordered appetizer day which sort battered and fried fish neck cabbage taco with sweet ginger tamarind sauce and pickled carrot and beet fish very fresh and meaty and not too oily considering had been deep fried we followed with steelhead trout and herb crusted halibut my mom we love seafood and these two dish definitely not disappoint my trout came out pink and perfectly cooked bed kale with mushroom vinaigrette adore kale and loved how they had crispy and sauteed kale in dish also tried bite my mom s halibut and fresh flavorful but nice and light late ish evening meal we finished with lemon meringue parfait server s recommendation and amazing loved meringue top and tarragon ice cream underneath never thought i d enjoy tarragon ice cream but complemented dessert really well lemon part tangy but sweet and graham cracker added texture otherwise smooth dessert overall came out about dollar u considering great service food and ambiance great deal and i ll definitely coming back in future

great food and amazing service had fried chickpea starter and they delicious want go back just eat them again my main steak and good but not exceptional dessert we had s more which come with homemade marshmallow by far best marshmallow ever tired cant wait eat again

and my friend jonas laforge had great time restaurant we ordered steak and frites and steak cooked perfection atmosphere great good get together with old friend next time we will few more drink and stay longer but we had wonderful time

had high hope fable but sadly they not deliver my partner and came in quick dinner and had tough time choosing what order because we not really want anything menu had offer thats new one anyway we settled chick pea fritter start they okay imagine falafel there you our main we had chicken and duck duck better but everything seemed sweet after taste very strange meal are homey heavy and more like wintery fare service good very attentive

got opportunity dine fable recent trip vancouver with two my friend can t say enough about restaurant trevor and curtis had their game night being little budget conscious grad school student we had try and make most our splurge meal without having take out loan finance food wise highlight meal proclaimed best canned tuna my friend and not even order initially but trevor insisted u trying and actually comped u had lot live up with name like and exceeded my expectation tuna jarred with potato lemon tomato and olive oil and slowed cook over time once you open jar crush and mix content you re in delightful experience there s sense intense richness with refreshing hint lemon my friend agreed when topped over toasted bread reminded u sort savory lemon bar food definitely worth trip in and however highlight night sitting counter facing kitchen there where we got see trevor and company what they best trevor curtis and whole staff personable and interactive throughout whole meal food just part dining experience important one course but atmosphere and interaction with staff also important by end night almost we had been friend with trevor et al long time we treated well in nutshell i d highly recommend fable sure get spot kitchen counter and hopefully you re experience will memorable ours

beyond yum quickly becoming my favorite restaurant in vancouver bc fresh and delightful food option get more delicious course by course enjoyed mussel with chorizo with broth good you will want drink you can keep classy and dip grilled bread accompanying instead chicken wing are perfectly crisp and sauced corn gnocchi with pesto and pulled pork epic delight drink are beautiful they are tasty and unique always experience great attentive service definitley make reservation course food fantastic in demand get list and you won t sorry fable magnificent adventure tastebud

we went there my birthday dinner and everything fabulous starting with appetizer canned tuna it s nothing like canned tuna made with albacore tuna and layered with potato and lemon good liver quite good too but won t my favourite meatball my friend had and yummy his only complaint wished could more main duck love duck breast and cooked perfect pickled beet side perfect side flat iron steak my hubby had and said good and loved side came with can t remember what they but apparently very delicious now highlight meal mean everything fabulous but their dessert out world good could licked whole bowl in privacy my house lemon pot de cream lemony custard with gin foam and grenada holy crap good not too sweet and too lemony just right amount sweetness needed after big meal opera torte my sister had and wasn t too sweet and not make feel like eating cup sugar and espresso ice cream and chocolate like match made in heaven cocktail had kiss from rose gin with rose syrup learn how make because too damn good dinner fantastic and we happy end meal

popped in lunch anyone can make nice burger tasty pasta real test restaurant lie in it creativity and standard ordered chick pea fritter and ling cod weird check pea friiter over roasted covered by thick layer mayo dressing ling cod few tasty piece cod sitting salad also covered by thick layer dressing my impression kitchen crew are young and experimental featuring sharp favour but not always combining favour in harmonious blend remarked there too much salad dressing food manager apologized and offered free dessert plus them would recommend diner should stick conventional food in restaurant

thank you michael l we stopped and went no further lol epic mind blowing dinner we ever had steak fritte and gnocchi with pork belly main and chickpea fritter appie food good took over our conversation entire evening not let sticker shock caesar fool you would almost classify appetizer candied pork belly stick with unique gazpacho base staff remarkable peaceful os make you think there may something yoga organic non gmo lifestyle wish had room order more item from their menu maybe next time

best restaurant i ve ever been too period and yes i ve been hawksworth wildebeest and like something compare brunch lunch dinner just drink end long day there no better place in city flavor explode off each dish served are just insane and right inline with wicked staff their ability paint visual picture everything new chef creates awesome recommend you start with oak coke and canned tuna and let flow from there can t pick just one main menu freshened up often dependent fresh ingredient course are sourced locally but can guarantee you can t go wrong
another place where owner chef care about food serf starting growing food roof establishment seasonal food done right love

home my favourite dish in whole world duck meatball with tagliatelle once when eating coat rack accidentally fell and got free dessert nice too chose lemon meringue parfait earl grey ice cream subtle and delicious

good atmosphere spaghetti and meatball appy good one time we ordered over salted though not fan canned tuna not sure it s popular there but hey everyones personal preference are different food fresh and unique

my brother tendency going fancy place when we go visit place it s tad annoying however my brother s best friend vancouver local suggested fable u our last brunch in vancouver definitely packed in there when we went we waited about minute and we seated right away which pretty surprising myself got scrambled egg fable brioche rosti o m g one best scrambled egg ever had in my life kid you not super impressed by place what can you say hipster know how their brunch will definitely come back when go back vancouver

went fable boozy brunch last sunday every month with my girlfriend they had been before and raved about needle say had pretty high expectation good booze indeed boozy and very very reasonable okay french toast ate but wasn t anything special too soft in middle bad we rushed out before hour even though our seating hour and half took forever drink make u they out ketchup because direct quote someone forgot make morning my girlfriend benny undercooked and not get compensation new plate my four dollar bacon side one piece bacon good but clarify somewhere my friend even said they appalled by service and they had never had experience like prior maybe bad day fable but won t returning based experience

we had friend coming in from out town and thought would great opportunity try out restaurant we ve heard much about hype true we enjoyed beautifully prepared dish in room reflects vancouver well great atmosphere crowd noise but not overwhelming you get feeling being in well liked comfortable place and can still carry conversation with table friend our server very friendly and professional when we asked recommendation proceeded explain each item in more detail and helped u make excellent choice portion quite generous and certainly filling lot great flavour had onion gnocchi with pulled pork and certainly would again sampled canned tuna which also excellent our friend from san fran loved vibe room friendly wait staff and overall experience we will definitely return highly recommended

not know what they put in their food but it s addictive often aggressive craving fable needle say food amazing service alway great too but space bit too jammed my liking though like said food make up my favourite item menu are spaghetti and meatball beef burger house green salad wild salmon

came with my husband his birthday we had always heard great review about fable looking forward trying time keeping relatively neutral expectation made reservation couple day in advance pm we seated right away small table in middle dining area we starving we ordered chickpea fritter and canned tuna two appetizer think we preferred chickpea fritter tuna definitely unlike anything i ve eaten anywhere else and interesting but not know out world lot reviewer made out although enjoyed light lemony flavor and unique texture potato and tuna just wasn t blown away still worth trying least once though entree ordered onion gnocchi with pulled pork and husband ordered flat iron steak with veggie flavor dish great pulled pork amazingly soft and tender and gnocchi large in size but soft and pillowy not heavy like one might expect from carby italian inspired dish husband had not tried flat iron steak before and not know what expect but flavorful not too tough and cooked perfectly medium rare service good our server friendly and various staff apologized when our entree came late they went extra step by comping our dessert s more brownie which really nice thing overall good experience fable one comment would it s not largest restaurant and get very loud when full capacity not fault restaurant course but it s something worth mentioning in case you re considering place quiet romantic date would definitely come back try out their brunch

my boyfriend and wanted check place out awhile but seems always slammed we started with chickpea fritter tonight presentation point but overkill salt our main entree we ordered steelhead trout and duck breast i m big fish eater but when took my first bite trout really fishy asked our server suppose made raw took back and made medium when came back better but still fishy kale salad came with trout drenched in super salty vinegary dressing duck breast with quinoa good overall dish hope just off day kitchen cause we quite disappointed
amazing try their gnocchi favorable very cute restaurant everything made fresh and very good customer service even owner might great you your table often

first impression are key and hostess start you off winning note time i ve been there wait hostess took my name and number and offered call when table ready with prime location west th my dining companion and had ample time walk around and window shopping waiting our table when table ready hostess fired off quick text and call let know place always packed but not feel loud overly crowded service friendly and attentive price are fair and quality excellent cocktail are delicious canned tuna fantastic chickpea fritter are great lemon meringue parfait really freaking good trust jody b s review menu item in term main meal my selection very tasty time but not blow my mind first time went dinner really wanted squash gnocchi but ordered steelhead trout instead because my dining companion ordered my first choice dish took one team add bit variety but wished had gotten gnocchi after my meal excellent no complaint but no gnocchi my second visit brunch and ordered fable egg dish savory flavor fan tomato jam s sweetness touch heavy but still finished every bite my dining companion and not however finish rosti side dish which little dry my one complaint would really really wish they had canned tuna available during brunch service complaint though overall am big fan place but it s not quite star one final impression hostess remembered my name thanks u coming upon our exit nicely done and perfect little touch mean lot and tell kind place want come back again and again
best ever eating experience in town delicious and fine food corner not too much pricy staff good and cooperative may in my next visit fable can earn star from

we in town three day and went many restaurant possible we had eat pm get into fable clearly they are very popular we enjoyed chambar immensely and highly recommend first choice in town we started with cornbread probably best cornbread ever had really special and recommend my spouse had special beef which prepared in sou vide piece meat extremely fatty expected imagine with cut point half serving inedible not sure how work around just bit disappointing pepper jelly they served with had bit soy kick and just really not make sense with everything else plate component good in total dish just not work had onion gnocchi with pulled pork again component passable but confusing dish gnocchi good it but pesto salty alone fine but needed something in plate calm pulled port actually really good pulled pork but made absolutely no sense with dish ended up feeling like had gone through buffet line really good buffet line given and picked up random item drink decent we ended up not getting dessert because frustrated with food service excellent and vibe in restaurant great almost never send thing back in restaurant really feel especially high end place like want your first and best effort and in case wasn t skill issue dish creation issue compare chambar felt like dish there inspired everything plate made much sense together found myself carefully constructing bite make sure not missing out anything end day think clearly one better place eat in town just really think work need done with critical eye flavor and texture combination chef skilled and experience positive end day food what matter most next time we are in vancouver we probably would give another shot

good food not great over sauced under seasoned uninspired presentation room ugly and cramped once guest arrive we ate there with friend very cold snowy night arrived dinner made wait outside dot i ve worked in restaurant before understand wanting wait last minute start onslaught but that s stupid service would been easy say come in sit we can t serve you till but least keep warm better yet here s drink you wait there guy in wheelchair they seated right in high traffic area server and customer had jostle him customer get around again easy problem solve unnoticed unimportant staff

fantastic food and atmosphere had great rich and we sat bar facing prep cook super funky and you really see effort and excellence being put into your food prep looking hip place amazing food check out

fable one my favorite restaurant right now place kit right th ave and trevor bird main guy there s reason top chef canada place isn t big but definitely cozy soon you walk in greeter take your name every time been there had wait bit get packed and no wonder believe worth service great waitress are super friendly kitchen right by entrance you get see guy cooking their butt off you wait such art love their smoked trout benny and their french toast brunch just perfection plate great flavour texture colour their egg are amazing just out farm their main vision using local ingredient fable never disappoints great success great restaurant best guy and keep up star
my favorite brunch in town you know feeling when you ate something good without disgusting fat feeling afterwards well place get feeling back

been many time now and each time five star experience although enjoyed my experience lunch what really impressed with brunch served only weekend menu change regularly but never had dish anything le than fabulous scrambled egg with fable brioche and potato my favorite brunch item egg soft and buttery but not runny and topped with bacon and spinach potato more like hash brown crisp and golden outside and soft inside my favorite dish benedict with salmon confit wait staff also very friendly and helpful it s perfect way start weekend
fantastic food and service loved relaxed atmosphere around great food canned tuna appetizer surprisingly delicious

really really good excellent service and food just great every single dish chickpea fritter been my mind since and diy salmon collar taco special night ridiculously tasty my gnocchi and pulled pork main dish large and in charge they not skimp portion would definitely return place next time i m in vancouver

headed over fable saturday morning brunch with friend from out town expected portlandia esque with lineup out door right when opened my surprise we not wait long even more surprising we weren t turned away when we said only party present we seated right away decor looked relatively old refuel but nice before and still menu looked very appetizing it s not big indecisive being in u would circle round and round before settling something and not small you are only presented with different way eat egg brunch everyone our table ordered something different special day smoked salmon benny being farm table we figured salmon would pretty fresh had omelette which came topped with mushroom and real bacon bit with side salad interesting brunch menu item and brick rosti also ordered side sausage mainly because interested in trying their tomato jam omelette perfect wasn t runny and fluffy mushroom very sweet and course bacon icing cake would liked mushroom and bacon inside omelette but also good also could used gooey cheddar goodness side sausage also amazing half expected traditional sausage what not expect and what got handmade sausage patty with tomato jam jam great twist regular ketchup sweet and texture tomato bit which welcome change from squirt bottle heinz overall serving size great value money considering brunch option in neighbourhood along with premium usually charged local organic fare great value very high quality food i d definitely come back and try benny come back sample their dinner menu
ultimate taste maker love their food and service place very pleasant and calm would love visit them again and again great guy keep up cheer
excellent everything great we ppl we shared different main dish and muscle appy also fresh baked corn bread amazing would go again and again

i ve now been time and everyrime come i m blown away last night went with friend dinner and we decided go fable we started with chickpea fritter and they we really tasty but duck basket just amazing came with gizzard neck and drumettes in really tasty glaze best appy i ve had there by far our entree my friend got duck breast and dish always good everytime we go decided try something not usually order and let tell you free range chicken got epic tender juicy and delish would really like know how they make chicken good will ordering again dessert we shared lemon meringue parfait not eat dessert but will eat it good service it s always fantastic can t wait go back and eat again fable awesomeness
really like food very fresh and tasty but make sure you book in advance place always full had duck breast main course and scallop appetizer very happy with these choice

best restaurant ever food beautifully done staff super friendly and welcoming space perfect fable honestly could not better my favorite dish steak fites just wait you try black pepper jam bottom plate cried good would recommend place anyone and everyone amazing

taken birthday dinner by my family had been our collective list think we knew about due top chef interior comfy brick and wood with chandelier made pitch fork and shovel reflect food table theme place thus name fable wall variety interesting artistic decoration chalk mural photo tree etc really liked our server into food but not in pretentious way can case with farm table place we had few tasty appetizer and unlike certain similar place cough cough forage they generous item bbq chicken drummets actually like meal pretty simple dish but sauce awesome shared standard menu item halibut though doubt anything standard since veggie would seasonal fish done perfectly good i m not fan pea generally avoid them and dish came with them with no warning but my hang up not knock against tasty array fiddlehead and item accompanies fish highlight surprisingly dessert we had rootbeer macroon which amazing tasted like those bottlecap candy from being kid lemon maringue parfait mind blowing layer after layer flavour and texture and tarragon ice cream made not come and not get personally wasn t tempted by dessert saw everyone in my party mentioned they would come back would plus there just something like about these place popping up th maenam etc

stunning my fianc e and went tonight strength yelp review and we re pleased we our server paul friendly informative and efficient and helped with great choice wine lovely okanagan grenache others mentioned chickpea fritter and we reiterate along with very original canned tuna starter duck sausage tortellini more asian in feel than italian like really light incredibly tasty dim sum sou vide stiletto beef with bok choi and mushroom outstanding in texture and flavour almost gamey finally our fragrant light lemon meringue parfait delivered with candle quite unexpectedly mark our anniversary sweet touch brilliant food lovely staff and relaxed feel we ll back

i ve heard lot about fable and told by numerous people had get my butt in there finally had chance when had family coming in visit from sacramento we made our way there dinner tuesday and kind but not really surprised how busy one people in our party lot allergy milk nut our server awesome with describing every dish and which one stay away from also got chef make sure thing left off plate completely our table kid we shared appies and entree and pretty stuffed by end we ordered chickpea fritter best canned tuna must get and spaghetti and meatball appies entree we got salmon butcher s cut die and roasted duck breast price added up pretty quickly but one those place where it s quality over quantity and quality top notch

foodie and food network geek will love menu service and even atmosphere cater passionate food lover entire service team helpful appearing take pleasure in explaining each plate and welcoming and question thrown their way fable made people live eat menu not radical departure from typical west coast canadiana but there are enough twist playful flavour combination and texture keep eater interested through every bite beef tartare come liberally dressed in sour cream based sauce fun play much loved sour cream and onion chip when paired with house fried potato chip oyster with pickled horse radish and citrus segment phenomenal and stand out dish night followed closely by gorgonzola cheesecake end evening print menu interesting and i m sure would not disappoint but ordering off chalk board updated very regularly am told where time playful food geek side chef trevor bird overpowers simplicity farm table menu but passion and creativity brings shine through making consistently interesting and exciting plate every bite unique in flavour and texture real pleasure eating fable sure everyone may doing farm table food these day but fable very well eating your thing go fable and enjoy
fantastic brunch and best service i ve had in vancouver in year keep up

tl dr get duck breast risotto and chickpea fritter place recommended by server heirloom told helped conceptualize acorn heirloom and fable from farm table and must try gathered bunch my girlfriend and we gave try i ve been back twice since course before going looked up yelp see what type review they getting and impressed duck seemed star and having never had before that s what got since there few u around table we ordered many item and shared my thought chickpea fritter amazing and well dressed just wish there more plate canned tuna perfect size not best sharing because you ll want lick out jar beet salad nothing write home about pumpkin risotto creamy flavorful generous portion duck breast like said my first time eating duck and now thanks fable am hooked crispy and tender and just melted in my mouth came with silky braised red cabbage tender parsnip and perfectly crunchy duck confit croquette duck and risotto highlight my night every time went loved place enough want try their lunch and their weekend brunch last but not least huge they take reservation
