brunch review only delicious food but not nearly enough stopped in brunch after recently planned beach day with jessica violet dear o rained out we cruising up w th when we spotted fable and realized we really wanted try out decision made we arrived shortly after restaurant opened day and promptly seated after passing their open kitchen where trevor bird his crew hard work normally bunch foodie such u would jumped chance sit bar and watch them work but we looking forward good gossip sesh and decided take table instead we ordered round drink and very pleased with big best brunch caesar with gin knew coffee also quite nice after perusing menu we settled dish grabbed our attention and happily provided with our plate in short order had scrambled egg delish and came in cute little mason jar with creamed spinach bacon mixture underneath egg proceeded scoop out every last bite and chased each with bite my toast soldier will say totally delightful just too small my dining companion felt similarly about their benny fable egg whole food excellent and would certainly return try their evening offering which look amazing but wouldn t recommend brunch unless they step up their portion brunch meal should tide you over from morning supper and just not sufficient

went restaurant having watched top chef canada in it entirety and received what believe top chef canada s best honestly exceeded my expectation appetizer we had sawmill bay oyster with vodka citrus canned tuna with crostini and duck meatball with tagliatelle oyster perfectly accented with what tasted like grey goose vodka and touch grapefruit and black pepper perfect balance still tasting seawater next play canned tuna which freshly canned raw albacore tuna lemon confit potato confit with olive oil poached in small mason jar served with grey salt crostini another perfectly balanced dish lemon like candy and potato and albacore welcomed grey salt harmonious duck meatball crispy outside medium rare inside stuffed with sauce served tagliatelle with parmesan foam big flavor from spice meatball allspice and fennel seed believe i m not big foam but had great mouthfeel and really tasted like parmigiano reggiano awesome my main potato crusted chicken with ratatouille kind dislike chicken it usually bland and easily dry trevor bird s version however tasted like soaked in milk crusted in potato and fried excellence ratatouille amazing freshly tasting basil and acidic enough counter richness potato chicken dessert curtis luk s macaroon cookie and pavlova absolute master work especially pavlova meringue melted in your mouth paired with blueberry cannot even imagine anything better when you combine food with personable fast efficient service reasonable price only outcome and my friend becoming regular and we not even live near neighborhood feeling pretty happy about having such talent in our city great work and keep up
had surprisingly delightful lunch hostess lunch professional and friendly menu choice interesting very fresh had mushroom polenta little lean mushroom but very unique and delicious

one best meal i ve ever had you can tell chef excited and take pride in food served it s interesting and thought out it fun we shared our course we could try more our server very accommodating and even split u which pretty cool we started with tomato soup and grilled cheese w onion jam holy shit delicious we also had duck meat ball cause seemed favorite indeed our favorite it flawless our main course we had fennel sausage cavatelli again just perfect flavor and texture complement each restaurant like give life believe hype place winner plan head get packed

i ve been wanting go fable because great food and service little disappointed perhaps my expectation too high took my sister and brother in law lunch tuesday we ordered best canned tuna best tuna and would come back again just order we lucky because last jar they had day my lunch wanted slow cooked salmon only find sold out opted ling cod dietary restriction no salt no dairy and no egg ling cod perfect however came with hollaindaise asked mustard vinaigrette went with salmon my brother in law ordered steak sandwich and lemonade my sister ordered pasta day with pea pesto chorizo parm tomato service day needed improvement when trying flag server they up front talking each they not notice u waving our hand our server forgot get my brother his lemonade halfway through when we reminded him apologized and gave him complimentary lemonade with my meal received hollandaise sauce which thought clear my server could not consume apparently not tell person serving my dish could not eat poor communication staff they also not suggest offer lemon put my fish lack sauce crowd thinning clear we had finished and had empty plate even put them way off one side plain day no one picking them up from u there even server hostess cleaning table next u and not pick up we felt there lack attention serving staff they need circulate more and aware their customer instead conversing up front our lunch came we thought our meal good not great except canned tuna service disappointing

yum yum yum yum we had really awesome meal last night service and food amazing first quick note about service fantastic our waitress attentive but not overbearing checked in u and because knew we had out by certain time had show get made sure we could order in time and got our food in time full three course without feeling rushed also suggested wine we ended up loving great food really tasty we had canned tuna man wish could buy stuff in store instead gross little tin tuna spread cracker delicious we also had chickpea fritter which really tasty two our table had steak and loved black pepper jelly and had gnocci had pumpkin risotto with fresh crab his only complaint expected more pumpkin but still delicious noticed someone else commented gnocchi hard recommend stand alone sure not protein with but say big dish and very filling thought tasty and fine stand alone anyway dessert we ended up with lemon tart table and chocolate beet fondant not try chocolate beet fondant but apparently delish thought my lemon tart die had really really good experience and will definitely back also l abbatoir week and thought fable better liked menu flavour and service better well done

amazing must go my hubby and went there last night and boy place exceed our wildest expectation we knew farm table place knew guy owns runner up master chef canada but about had smoked duck with brussel sprout and die come out fun skillet brought u by chef could eat everyday brown butter sauce amazing my hubby had duck special remember how amazing bed lentil under we had fried duck giblet entree with waldorf salad and soo good nicer meal worth value we paid just under buck main entree bread beer and large bottle san palegrino make reservation we went monday and busy owner class there baby next table and brought baby out carrot puree go and support guy cheer christina

excellent service great food had arctic char and shared chickpea fritter canned tuna exceeded my expectation great flavour only odd thing arctic char served huge plate and placed side leaving lot blank white space tasted amazing no point deducted will definitely back

had unplanned dinner there with hubby night enjoyed every course had canned tuna hubby had chickpea fritter and then we moved steak frites and pork with corn cob dinner special hubby his dinner summer plate and steak frites perfect lean and flavorful cut steak with pepper jelly tender crisp veggie and frites fantastic triple cooked they crispy outside and mealy inside just how like them without bad one in pile service great friendly and attentive but not intrusive my only regret we not room dessert we ll need come back

food prepared with love knowledgable friendly staff deliver excellent service had lettuce wrap appetizer offered special which came with salmon pickled fennel cilantro and pickled onion pickled fennel especially good and added unique flavor highly recommend restaurant

fable must visit cozy decore and food incredibly good try canned tuna and chef s tasting menu and friendly and attentive service also you get chance sit chef s bar great way chat about food and see how everything made amazing date night and am sure we will back soon chris

had heard about fable through our csa program fable buy produce through local farm we went my dad s birthday and food excellent had milk poached chicken which super juicy and delicious our table also tried squash gnocci good beef stiletto they out frites cheesecake and sweet bite portion generous and we ended up with leftover lunch next day our only complaint fact we had reserved table in advance and they asked special occasion which but we seated first table which heavy traffic from kitchen and front door regretted having hostess hang up my jacket every time someone opened front door draft blew over our table would enjoyed our experience much better had we been seated further inside restaurant and will keep in mind in future we will back

with top chef canada s trevor bird and curtis luk in kitchen regular basis course farm table concept going amazing menu change with season and my first trip fable we had brunch with capital b because good we got there just door opened sunday morning small crowd waiting outside warmth and comfort amazing food we seated right away and although had made up my mind ahead time from reading menu online threw caution wind and changed up what going get last second sounded good how could possibly only choose one dish easy make sure your friend get something different from you lol my friend d got salmon benny and pretty much got straight up egg and hash we also ordered side their house bacon with apple jam and house sausage with black pepper jam food amazing however there one component meal outstanding my meal came with tomato jam now most foodie myself included would probably think just fancy house made ketchup which exactly what expecting wow wrong actually tomato jam chunk tomato sweet like jam can t even put into word how mind blowing saved good teaspoon piece toast my last bite always save best last left with happy tummy warm and comforted by food made by people used watch tv could not happier maybe could maybe just maybe i ll stop in dinner sometime see what savory goody they concocted

just went dinner last night with my wife we had great meal we started with chickpea fritter they great maybe tad dry but great and then had halibut and had steak frites everything fresh and drink are amazing would recommend visiting but make sure you reservation

delicious went few week ago in vancouver work and i m still thinking about b c oyster these my colleague s first oyster and loved them start we shared chickpea fritter loved combination curry mayo and pickled onion with fritter my main had steak frites and wasn t disappointed one bit but highlight dessert we shared gorgonzola cheesecake you can definitely taste blue cheese in but it s not overpowering cheesecake very creamy and pear cut through give just right amount sweetness must try

i ve been three time once dinner and twice brunch you can t go wrong with anything and their caesers are just ridiculous good dinner halibut and gnocchi great and cornbread special starter perfect portion size are good high quality food you re getting and service really impressed u we sat bar with great view kitchen our favourite spot and chef are always working away in totally calm and precise manner you gotta buy kitchen growler it s option menu and our experience definitely great enough warrant our server funny and friendly and really lovely and relaxed place great meal it s completely unpretentious just fantastic food without snobbery can sometimes accompany good wine list too will go again

found place in odd fashion my wife and had one day spend in vancouver we looked online and found someone s review perfect day in vancouver included day trip kit and eating fable said special place and my wife and are very happy we took shot in dark and what awesome restaurant we got there just in time brunch actually we late but wait staff seated u anyway we had just finished walking better part mile and can t tell you how much we appreciated can t remember what name dish ordered but omlette sort and delicious they tomato jam good we bought take home highly recommend place anyone visiting kit unfortunately tsa took jam we bought from u our return u wonder can order more

really thought restaurant over rated perhaps it off night chef we ordered wrong dish just felt like we overpaid meal decor staff ambiance however excellent because good review feel obligated give place another try and give another review feel like one those place where appetizer are better than main course

great idea left wanting bit more love local farm table restaurant and concept work well well think what set off from start being seated closest washroom when had booked least month in advance bad not having stated in reservation my aversion but aversion not like make fuss went with evening but tone set had cocktail very recommended something with cider looked just like shirley temple when arrived and good but not great and tart sweet one still not sure canned tuna appetizer came highly recommended and idea super but taste left wanting something more brininess le than pleasing and honest not sure what potato doing there something little spicier would been nice son had very respectable flank steak with almost mole sauce would not enjoyed but loved too dark but beef seared beautifully exactly how meat should cooked son had tuna nicoise wasn t hungry and perfect salad but tuna again not spark deliciousness know can best saved last though and gnocchi had squash gnocchi sans pork blech and love pork but what combo and divine love making gnocchi and it s hard get large gnocchi taste perfect and not overcooked liked light searing in butter oil well they perfect seriously could done without sweet yam saucy gravy swiped plate too sweet but they would served up with spring onion pine nut and bucket olive oil might never left might back again just gnocchi best ever upping star simply personal touch and staff how wonderful remembered and yes will mention my preference up front next time

my first five star rating go fable went there last night and had great night service ambience and food fantastic we warmly greeted upon arrival and staff made u feel really welcome and home not usually get feeling in restaurant six u ordered much food appys included canned tuna cornbread mushroom flatbread my least favourite and chickpea fritter my favourite main included steak delicious scallop and pork belly mmmmm good duck probably best i ve ever had another reviewer said gnocchi good but more would been nice eggplant parmesan delicious loved way they kept eggplant whole covered in cheese and fried crunchy perfection and halibut delicious not even described cocktail dessert pretty satisfying our server friendly attentive and helpful without being overbearing we had two different red wine going and good job remembering drinking what really impressed with fable and hope go back tomorrow breakfast maybe

warm little restaurant love atmosphere came with friend brunch and tried their benedict with olive oil hollandaise and ham melted in my mouth amazing bit comfort food love their hash well crispy and well seasoned we had wait min before getting seated but there are small shop around area and we easily passed time browsing and spending more brunch with unexpected purchase new wallet oops would definitely come back try their dinner time

our family vacation from los angeles and happened find fable one top rated canadian restaurant in vancouver we decided go there and glad we ordered rossdown farm chicken my brother ordered duck breast and my mother ordered zucchini tagliatelle we very pleased with meal went beyond my expectation especially concerned my mother not like cheese nor cream however very pleased with zucchini tagliatelle without cheese mentioned how delicious sauce thank you fable very memorable dinner experience love fan from la

delicious had zucchini stuffed blossom appetizer followed by whole sea bass caught in ontario presentation beautiful and blend favor and texture well thought out kudos chef dessert strawberry shortcake parfait creative and delicious not miss gem place

my go celebratory dinner nice vibe and amazing food basically order gnocchi with pulled pork every time can t comment much rest menu definitely worth price i d suggest reservation restaurant isn t huge and fill up pretty quick
probably best restaurant in vancouver today unbelievable service second none chickpea fritter are outsstanding steak frites die my only complaint they ran out red racer ipa and rhubarb desert tsk
service excellent and pork belly special with house made cavaletti rich and absolutely deeeeeeeelish would definitely go again

fable s boozey brunch last sunday each month definitely something check out offering orange grapefruit mimosa and ceasar s how can you go wrong will admit caesar taste bit ketchup y but rough sunday can t complain restaurant completely packed and there great buzz about place ordered fable egg and my boyfriend ordered farmer s muffin we also ordered side their homemade bacon yup said homemade yum yum yum despite being busy our meal arrived within reasonable time frame my fable egg came with sunnyside egg lardons mushroom potato kale rustic bread and tomato jam dish nice but certainly not best brunch dish i ve ever eaten bottom plate filled with liquidy substance i m guessing from mushroom but i m not entirely sure just bit strange and not something would expected see in my dish friend table had ordered thing and also had plate full mushroom juice well seemed part dish not mistake surprisingly my favourite part dish tomato jam added just right amount sweetness my savoury dish and helped wrap together quite nicely my boyfriend s farmer s muffin included sausage scrambled egg cheddar tomato jam salad and potato rosti looked like deconstructed muffin sandwich plate sausage very tasty hit day tomato jam everything plate went very well together no complaint in flavour and taste department we will absolutely back fable very soon we love boozey brunch idea and thought price brunch menu extremely reasonable portion could slightly bigger but overall great value quality food although fable egg whole weren t my favourite there are item menu i m excited try cheer

took advantage business associate being in town try out place live around corner and keep walking past impressed with selection microbrews tap and cocktail menu had great looking drink we started with chickpea fritter which great share and then moved our main my guest visiting from toronto they obviously went with smoked salmon and had nothing but great thing say about myself being vegetarian there limited option entree but eggplant parmesan hand one tastiest meal had in vancouver date usually vancouver restaurant pas off bowl pasta in cream sauce lame roasted veggie acceptable vegetarian entree which absolute bullshit having thoughtful artful vegetarian entree breath fresh air convinced they had mixed up mushroom bolognese with beef had ask server check out end meal gentleman assumed owner came out and assured mushroom sauce and thanked u coming in great food great service great atmosphere will definitely return

fable opened by top chef runner up trevor bird in may year like few great new restaurant opening up around vancouver fable about delivering delicious locally sourced food from farm table love name been meaning dine quite time but west ender not venture out kitsilano often should one saturday during move jake and decided treat ourselves delicious brunch out and fable upon walking into fable you feel instantly relaxed and comfortable it s rustic warm and not pretentious feeling in slightest feel like that s quite rare these day with new hip joint opening up seating area open creating nice social barn like atmosphere server are dressed in button up shirt adding immaculate rustic theme ordered scrambled egg curtis brioche rosti walter s egg saut ed spinach bacon and parmesan star egg delicious prepared really well and served in little mason jar topped with bacon bit spinach and light parmesan foam cannot fault their egg in slightest they perfectly made brioche soft and fluffy should home made strawberry jam delightful will need make my one day you can taste difference with one come out jar and hash cake crunchy outside hashy inside yoghurt chive dollop really added flavour jake ordered egg benedict with olive oil hollandaise and halibut brandade star hollandaise make break egg benny in my mind fable s hollandaise light lemony and not too heavy and overpowering just perfect in saying dish creamy whole but again not in overpowering way halibut cake subtle but preferred alternative heavy salmon top off meal we received two home made cranberry white chocolate cooky not best cookie i ve had fair but cute freebie am desperate come back fable their dinner service which hear casual with fine dining service also worth noting their latte one best i ve had in vancouver and kiwi that s saying lot price service atmosphere overall review by crumb fight http crumbfight com fable from farm table

went there with party which included x yr old boy and two mom school strike day fantastic service and even better food boy loved their food and adult chickpea critter especially quite delightful boy had specially kind word lemonade and grilled cheese sandwich very friendly staff and love how owner make effort come talk diner overall great experience exactly what you want dining out experience we made into day trip from north vancouver and worth drive and then

entree ordered steak frites steak well seasoned and cooked order perfectly side ok nothing special but not bad they served what they called blackberry jam sauce but honestly tasted like asian black bean sauce buttermilk rabbit feature meal not standard menu very tasty rabbit but people ordered wished cooked differently note general consensus our group potato wedge not great and definitely could ve been done better service excellent service very friendly and knowledgeable never ran out water food served pretty quickly which worked well u

been fable twice once dinner and once weekend brunch dinner great food good and service attentive brunch okay and service stupendous went with my friend child and baby very family friendly server manager saw kid getting restless brought over colouring book and small toy occupy boy make sure your entire party there they wont seat you arrived would go back dinner though bit pricier end guess that s price pay farm table local food
wonderful paddock plate style restaurant staff really friendly and there really fast service food delicious and you can tell fresh would recommend restaurant anyone in area

must missing something cuz read review before we went but not experience staff awesome professional kitchen look like it s under control and clean and knowledgeable but not find food memorable we went lunch and there wasn t much menu we got sandwich and tomato soup and something else can t even remember great staff but boring food can t even remember what we had sorry guy won t going back

overpriced and undernourished crowded cafe style dining with limited pretentious menu small portion exorbitant price with average service never thought vancouverites could undiscerning in their dining

think my favorite restaurant ever they never disappoint we ve always been fan and love canned tuna would order these and eat only dinner could but i d probably get weird stare most recently we came their valentine s special menu amazing usual every dish came absolutely delicious my guy practically hogged sablefish entree and not even normally like fish only thing wish they would bring back lemon parfait dessert loved thing please make again

go youre missing out my boyfriend and came quick dinner food incredible ordered chicken with risotto and ordered steak frites and can tell you we inhaled food and almost licked plate top we received our food within minute ordering not even know how they made such savoury and gourmet meal fast one my new favourite spot food excellent top notch delicious service really knowledgable server and fast service ambience it perfect mix modern trendy cozy upscale laid back love
one my favourite vancouver restaurant been number time always love canned tuna you can definitely bring your kid too least

probably best service i ve ever had in restaurant attentive fast helpful friendly we not wait we brought in and served immediately we ordered steak frites medium rare and got exactly fry hot and crispy not care too much brown steak sauce reminded marmite though my husband thought like black bean sauce beef tasted fresh though my steak little chewy still had room dessert had lemon meringue parfait based server s recommendation ok but wouldn t get again my husband thought his dolce de leche cheesecake ok but wouldn t get again either overall star food star ambiance star service bill came

not been dinner yet but i ve been brunch about time and it s amazing basically fable celebrity it d mila kunis it s classy earth unique and taste something new suggest benny brunch and not forget one their freshly squeezed mimosa how good service tipped and i m usually cheap that s how awesome there
perfect meal sit bar and drink and eat with ben bartender take his word excellent meal smoked duck maple cake divine enjoy

we came our bi annual staff lunch first time many u fable arranged reservation in advance through kathy and extremely helpful working with our large party and limited budget in advance we served chickpea fritter and canned tuna appetizer delicious entree fantastic well grilled cheese pasta tagliatelle gluten free tagliatelle with zucchini pasta and burger everyone really enjoyed their meal food presented beautifully and service prompt cheerful and professional thanks folk fable making our little celebration enjoyable and easy

came few week back saturday brunch went opening line not too crazy hostess able seat u relatively quickly had stew interesting quite tasty but not amazing one u had benny which not bad well we had complimentary cooky end meal service great but food not blow away

my girlfriend and went place dinner friday night when we arrived we nicely greet by our hostess and we sat near back restaurant night found dinning room hot and guess heat must came from kitchen air conditioning not turn from menu we ordered duck wing special duck breast and scallop special duck wing special pretty interesting appetizer and it basically deep fried duck wing duck neck and duck heart tasted pretty good perfectly cooked wing with bbq sauce duck breast dish it s debatable my taste duck greatly well prepared meat juicy and moist however quinoa side dish not my cup tea quinoa nut and dried cherry mixed side dish too empowering simple duck breast and make meat like side dish instead scallop special well done perfectly cooked scallop with blended corn butter sauce overall dish well presented but think price little high v portion size dish may try tem again special occasion
can hit and miss depending what you choose appys are yummy but sometimes main aren t good
not negative word say about my experience food had fried trout with carrot puree and roast vegetable with green salad clean much yum can t wait try more

such incredible dining experience my parent visiting in town and had heard incredible thing about fable booked reservation and instantly seated when we walked in our server knowledgeable almost overly friendly and happy answer question we had recommended chickpea fritter and canned tuna incredible my dad point out expected tuna raw and came out cooked thought delicious and would ve been just good way also sauce came with chickpea fritter divine ordered gnocchi with pulled pork after hearing high praise from our server can honestly say one best dish i ve ever had restaurant mix perfectly cooked vegetable pillowy and soft gnocchi and absolutely incredible pulled pork just die my mom ordered butcher s cut which flat iron steak and my dad had pasta special night which came with bacon and few mixed veg top impressed and my parent are incredibly hard please when come restaurant thank you fable wonderful and unforgettable dining experience can t wait come back next special occasion
had dinner and drink with my friend and had great time everything we ate good had spaghetti and meatball appy and chicken my main service atmosphere and food star will back

vacation from east coast and had dinner due yelp review first off want say service excellent everyone very friendly helpful attentive and star star rating more food there in our party and we each ordered something different get taste many item possible appetizer we ordered canned tuna chickpea fritter and flatbread canned tuna too sweet my taste and overwhelmed subtleness tuna more jam than tuna chickpea fritter okay but nothing special eaten lot falafel half price overall not special enough elevated deconstructed falafel flatbread okay again nothing special outside nice crispy pork belly chunk our main course we had duck breast potato wrapped chicken salmon and steak frites had duck breast medium rare and problem fat skin and flesh not rendered love crispy duck skin but skin underdone soft and with raw fat inedible had cut off fat and skin only eat duck flesh thereby rendering only half entree in my opinion skin key component having duck breast entree potato wrapped chicken disappointing potato around chicken dense inch layer tasteless potato overall dish bland steak frites skirt steak and tasty but portion smaller than expected came with mushroom top spicy hoisin sauce interesting my eleven year old son had salmon and thought too lemony bite but had and not issue overall food average but given price paid and expectation from excellent review disappointing dinner said before service great and waitress came by couple time and asked how everything giving u ample opportunity mention these issue maybe duck correctable but others what we left alone and just nodded thing good

came last night with my girlfriend our anniversary with reservation pm i d suggest making reservation least day in advance late weekend night place packed and happening hostess greeted u with happy anniversary and seated u right time our waitress great very knowledgeable product and not pushy with our drink purchase we ended up ordering chick pea fritter and canned tuna start chick pea fritter absolutely phenomenal wow combination curry sauce and red onion die and something come back alone little sceptical canned tuna since am really not fan cooked even warm fish but mixture ingredient work well it s hard explain really but fish isn t cooked but mini mason jar it s served in warmed in water believe and wow great and think had more than my girlfriend even though she s fish eater u two main had squash gnocchi with pulled pork and astounded calling gnocchi like eating little cloud and also saying pulled pork best ever had in her entire life and concurred with got duck breast and cheese perogies and after first bite almost in tear how delicious our server had suggested getting duck medium rare medium depending your taste and said you get medium it s bit chewy got medium and perfect though correct about little bit chewiness everything about dish screamed am best thing you ever eaten and scream absolutely spot price our meal expected before coming in not bother u and believe worth every penny one thing sorta sucked u we too full desert but then also good thing because we thoroughly enjoyed every bite but next time we are coming you smores desert we will back sure

review come month late but month after my first visit my boyfriend and decided come back our year anniversary think say how much we love place it s small size restaurant in kit where refuel used get very busy and loud inside apparently there are lineup get in now they take limited reservation by email email them you not want risk standing out in rain another tip ask sit by bar normally would not been excited having worked in restaurant kitchen before expecting super hot and hectic however chef calm it s cool watching how they work and attention they put into plating chef trevor also like go out and talk with bar patron when it s not too busy admit rooting him take top chef title little star struck meeting him but very chill guy talk and you can tell how passionate about food and really care what you think about their food good bad food bread not complimentary but we decided get house made rosemary bread good bread fresh you can really taste rosemary and it s nice get bite sea salt just not sure would get again main we had duck breast and eggplant parmesan and mushroom bolognese eggplant parm very good and perfectly crispy pasta al dente and mushroom bolognese very flavourful winner night duck breast moist and juicy and went well with accompaniment we actually got last one night seems like very popular dish we ended off with daily sweet bite which white chocolate macadamia cooky pavlova with blueberry compote and macarons wanted get because judge raved much about chef curtis macarons but not like dessert are too sweet macarons and pavlova much too sweet my liking my boyfriend biggest sweet tooth loved them though meal with glass wine came out little over it s not place would go often because price but definitely good once in treat great food but casual and unpretentious

had been there before brunch always star brunch but nothing would spur review went diner had gnocchi wow tasty gnocchi waitress took her sweet hipster time getting u we flagged someone else great waiter wish would gotten his name great waiter not in your face no pissy face perfect with delicious gnocchi

hand star rating went first time brunch with friend very busy but we arrived before line up started which i m grateful decor pleasant and even with restaurant being full wasn t too loud our server whitney just delightful never in my life had such stellar customer service every time walked by her table eyed up drink ensure everyone had water and coffee without interrupting had duck confit salad with braised kale poached egg and potato just delicious whitney had cleared my plate soon put my fork might just ordered another one knew kale could taste good i ll definitely back update not been back yet said friend and had brunch new restaurant every month we recently reviewed our year and fable topped our list favourite brunch that s basically gold star congrats fable
fantastic canadian cuisine really impressed loved ambiance service food and wine list been twice now only brunch mind you but time absolute delight

food creative and unique but service what really impressed staff helpful and friendly love restaurant non alcoholic menu in addition their cocktail yummy in house soda fable best meal had during my stay in vancouver

we there dinner late last week place nice and when we sat and handed menu frankly expecting more ever wrong menu description seem rustic but food fantastic we ordered and shared canned tuna based review spagetti meatball and gnocchi flavor great and ingredient fresh place would visit again

not really understands hype and good review my bf took there my bday dinner couple week ago food barely ok main dish are bad not like complaining restaurant unless hair in something not complain fresh oyster star appy we got not too bad star corn bread good bottle white wine not cold enough star main dish sable fish star my bf s rating my chicken dish star dry and boring it s like eating cardboard ratatouille good but can t save dish desert just ok
delicious awesome service great menu and well priced high key recommend little kitsalano treasure took friend there from out town sampled much menu and we thoroughly enjoyed our time

fable make food could eat every day rest life okay maybe not literally every day rest my life but what mean kind food love simple clean truthful want leave restaurant feeling joyful and satisfied not stuffed knowing spent my hard earned money meal thoughtfully prepared and what got fable my trout lovely pickled mushroom yes please and gnudi delicious and get macaron three fabulous service fair price overall wonderful meal experience
literally everything brunch menu looked amazing went with farmer s muffin and not disappointed now just go back more time try out rest

not impressed by brunch month ago thing overly flavoured too salty too sweet and nothing really stood out but decided place needed nd try and loved dinner tonight opted two appetizer instead main had canned tuna no joke best canned tuna i ve ever had and spaghetti meatball duck meat ball tagliatelle dish trevor made top chef dish outstanding i m personally huge fan canned tuna trevor must been off enjoying bc day long weekend but curtis there doing wonderful job holding fort ate bar and got chat with curtis and rest crew friendly attentive service throughout i d definitely go back again but would probably stick with dinner only night watched plate and plate duck breast and potato crusted chicken ratatouille try main i d definitely give chicken try rarely see chicken dish restaurant tempt one looked promising course not think you can go wrong with duck either had peach melba dessert wrap up warm evening in vancouver you can t really go wrong with deliciously poached peach with vanilla ice cream raspberry sorbet

place amazing we staying granville island and just looked up place brunch and lucky enough find fable we wanted take little morning walk seemed perfect and great food unique cocktail and stellar service highly recommended

went there brunch and totally overrated luckily wait time fairly quick service and ambiance good but food nothing special and portion size and value really lacking three egg omelet think not we found flavor totally unbalanced everything too sweet despite fact u ordered savory dish condiment sauce jam served alongside johnny cake sausage scrambled egg sweet and overpowered everything yourself favor and go oakwood cafe medina instead

really like their service and fairly priced brunch weekend hooray service very genuine and super friendly they not take reservation brunch and line up can get long very fast you gotta come early and score table price reasonable brunch pretty much most menu under want pay over brunch love homey wooden decor it s cozy and comfortable my omelette yummy and generously portioned server come around with coffee your cup never empty long would love come back casual brunch weekend

fable can say where you been my life friend and went brunch your adorable kit location couple week ago and aaah mazing food innovative fresh and delicious and staff standout friendly and knowledgeable can t wait go back and try everything menu

atmosphere great and very welcoming considering rain and wind outside we got right evening opening sunday and seated right away definitely get busy would recommend reservation larger party their menu pretty limited but with quite lot daily special there s good amount choice ordered bc salmon my friend had duck confit from daily special and we ended with s more everything great i m not normally fan salmon but really tender and paired with interesting side beet foam worked really well duck flavorful especially skin crispy and delightful server are attentive food came out fast only improvement would wifi connection currently very unstable
really good food different feel it s not one those big restaurant but rather cozy one slightly pricy but had good experience time been there will definitely recommend people

went with group friend in club and tried their sandwich lunch food good and service great we appreciated how they able accommodate many people we had almost and portion size spot would like try macarons someday after seeing one owner top chef canada

hubby booked surprise dinner u and what great surprise special event reunion dinner with past top chef canada we began with chef dennis tay s arroz caldo something deconstructed dumpling start and delicious dough little bit over cooked but otherwise flavor right second course chef nicole gomes skuna bay salmon which my favorite you had try next chef danny smile molokhia seared duck fresh pasta pickled shallot and chicken chicharron pasta perfectly cooked duck beet butter brought everything together in chicken chicharron fourth course by chef geoff rogers beef short rib cooked perfectly tender with pepper jelly die and popcorn with vegetable resin can t explain but think fluffy flavored white powdery snow flake last but not least chef and owner trevor bird bean ice cream which your choice topping made table side with fresh milk infused with tonka bean taste like vanilla but with cinnamony spicey edge yummy o i ll back support our local chef and hope you too quaint farm inspired decor super friendly and knowledgable staff and trevor great guy too i ll back another one these event sure

we had last minute reservation fable our recent trip vancouver evening began nicely enough we seated greeted by our waiter and placed our order quickly deteriorated when young woman bringing our bread knocked entire glass water into my lap cold snowy night and being drenched in icewater dining not in my plan we had not ordered appetizer but after water wiped up from floor our table and degree my clothing only moment my salmon arrived beautifully plated and looked forward enjoying once my husband s meal delivered unfortunately my plate sat in front full minute before his dinner arrived in time manager appeared and apologized situation explained tri tip steak my husband had ordered new item and had not shown up prepared our waiter bring over appetizer my husband diabetic and needed eat would something by time his entr e arrived cold but we made best manager andy came over tell my husband would take care by which we assumed meant would take my husband s dinner off bill food absolutely delicious perfectly prepared and magnificently showcased we ordered lemon meringue parfait share dessert and delicious lemon curd and lemon ice cream topped with swirl italian meringue absolutely melted tongue after our tea coffee we asked check our waiter brought and total we asked andy and told him we not comfortable with we appreciated his offer cover my husband s entr e but not feel necessary andy insisted too many thing went wrong expect u pay meal we argued but finally accepted his very gracious gesture charming small farm table restaurant deserves it outstanding and growing reputation we would written good review even had they not comped our meal

they not take reservation unless you re ready in line like am get ready wait hour we had party and waited hour min table and by time we got our door almost hour in it s tiny tiny inside that s wait bad food chorizo benedict they not actually menu anymore lol but subbed bacon chorizo instead and also added avocado i m not really biggest benedict fan but after seeing them serve benny neighbor wanted one real bad benny sooo delicious come with hash brown which thought just okay sausage dipped in pancake batter really rich come with good share with table think whole dish myself would too much br l e d grapefruit soo interesting think you should def try one sugar scorched top grape fruit like regular cr me br l e strawberry banana french toast good but average toast really thick and filling dish come with ton food service like said place busyyy expect long wait food after you order ambiance brunchy casual tiny cramped only good small group i d back

think we waited in line breakfast solid hour and only monday can t imagine what it s like weekend regardless worth our waitress great our food and drink came out in no time and best tasting food i ve had in long time my classic egg benedict die egg cooked perfectly hollandaise rich and creamy yet somehow still light english muffin fluffy and tasted like homemade and ate home fry without and ketchup because they not must canada thing and not even mind because they great texture and flavor decided splurge and get banana walnut pancake side well and i m happy might felt like going barf after stuffing my face much but well worth pancake fluffy and moist banana cooked and caramelized perfectly simply delicious know everyone else table got benedict s said they amazing too we also had alcoholic drink which really hit spot after waiting hr had bailey iced coffee and dirty chia strong and super tasty my boyfriend had bloody mary bloody caesar they call and said great you ever are in vancouver and opportunity go joint highly recommend you suck up and wait in line you will not disappointed

whenever ask anyone which brunch and breakfast place they d recommend it s always jam cafe and it s not just recommendation but you can tell from consistent lineup everyday place something special took long time try jam cafe out because usually not want wait in line long time but finally got chance try and understand what hype about waiting in line wasn t long when went weekday waited about minute soon we got inside and received our food compensated entirely time we spent waiting it s ridiculously good best brunch and breakfast i ve had in long time dish are pricey but they re huge you definitely get what you pay server attentive too because you kind in such busy cafe overall loved experience and definitely would come back

good thing come those wait certainly true vancouver s jam cafe where line form before they open weekend wait can stretch long two hour popular local restaurant with knowledge in hand we planned our well timed visit monday morning around am and escaped with only minute wait they ve certainly squeezed many table they could inside their dining room which are decorated with various country knick knack their vast seasonal menu span breakfast and lunch nothing fancy just good old fashioned comfort food my husband s harrison salmon scramble heaping pile egg scrambled with onion cream cheese topped with few slice smoked salmon came hearty multigrain toast usually salmon dish tend skimp fish but one certainly not usd scramble generously portioned served with side mixed green with chickpea in vinaigrette my teenage daughter sulked when told her only order single double chocolate pancake instead triple stack although hate pas up good deal could not even eat entire chocolate laden pancake leaving her plate which eagerly ate turn out mother know best after much deliberation finally decided dutch baby with apple and cinnamon arrived in hot cast iron skillet beautifully puffy ring with fruit in middle liked not too sweet and not send into sugar coma though double chocolate pancake managed trick even though food homespun charm jam cafe take extra care in presentation with each dish photo ready service friendly and efficient too we emerged belly happy and full you re willing wait jam cafe s definitely place generous portion food made with love

i ve now been jam cafe multiple occasion and recommend people love breakfast food their egg benny are amazing always perfectly cooked with delicious hollandaise sauce sometimes wish accompaniment benny bit better they tend look small by themselves plate because they re only served with hash brown i ve had charlie bowl multiple occasion and highly recommend sharing splitting with one two people what learned worked fantastically get one charlie bowl and one full order cinnamon pancake split three people personally like subbing gravy mushroom gravy give my artery bit relief their fried chicken yummy their waffle are yummy they poach mean egg in health not your biggest priority you should give place try

best brunch place ever always avoided maple syrup because one in america are just too sweet and yucky but real maple syrup sooo much better they even had home made jalape o sauce awesome fried chicken and egg english muffin delicious perfect combination my friend ordered three pig and sauce really good not exactly what there wait get into restaurant most time but think totally worth waiting

omfg place life up hype am still dreaming cinnamon swirl pancake and talking about them these best pancake ever eaten and make gourmet pancake weekly my son told our server are better hahaha but wrong these are amazing flavor profile over top delicious with layer sweet goodness could again would skip savory meal and order different layer pancake cinnamon swirl not flavor would chosen would chosen red velvet blueberry lemon even chocolate chocolate chip but now cannot imagine pancake tasting better than these worth wait and wish we would eaten earlier our trip we could try pancake flavor note table next u looked like they ordered savory pancake with pulled pork and pickled onion top

not enough word describe place but sum up amazingggg place must go you are in vancouver we arrived around am friday and place packed already we waited about minute but am not complaining totally worth please note you bigger party wait might little longer our waitress really nice had asked her what s in jam iced coffee responded it s really good you should get sold lol told her wanted not care not answer my question lolol you can tell loved working there that s always good sign portion big we went breakfast but ended up being brunch u we ordered their version bloody mary and delicious i m actually not fan bloody mary s but place killed we ended up ordering two recommend trying everything but list what we ordered and my personal recommendation charlie bowl loved you get later tator bowl classic tin cup milkshake chocolate get jam iced coffee great ice coffee old town breakfast blassic jam bacon con caesar sooooo good bourbonator bacon caesar get him too fry side i ll back

when you see place open am and already person lineup you know it s overhyped and yes jam overhyped will not revolutionize your life not enough worth absurd lineup form you arrive time after opening but it s damn solid menu can tell you much i ve often avoided brunch because menu tend look bunch variation egg benny sandwich one three variation each skillet pancake and maybe waffle jam still fall into high carb north american cuisine but most dish are very least twist usual incorporating thing like southern biscuit naan tater tot and deep fried sausage tried tater bowl and personally found good overall tater crunchy and plentiful and cheese nice touch though bit sparse pulled pork fine but say i ve had more flavourful pulled pork several place very plain and portion are absolutely bonkers realistically tater bowl charlie bowl could handily feed two people you re not blown away you ll stuck with lot just okay leftover also tried dutch baby excited because it s similar traditional dish in my family something we call bismarck large crispy cr pe pancake filled with buttery sweet unfortunately dutch baby definitely not crisp it s puffy and fairly soggy and really just okay i m torn how rate jam want give star creative menu but want give star food being just fine and hype and wait being very off putting think i ll stick with now because ended up feeling like i d waited lot okay good food and felt like would preferred pay le half portion size rather than get much something wasn t super impressive but want go back because maybe menu item will click with better that s draw creative menu guess

oh jam cafe ever since tried one in victoria several year ago it s been my go brunch spot despite long lineup visit we went saturday pm and had wait about minute before being seated taste having ordered charlie bowl nearly every time i ve gone jam cafe decided try gravy coop time delicious and beautifully presented sunny side up egg perfectly cooked with deep orange yolk oozing out soon cut into them outside fried chicken crunchy and well seasoned inside juicy and tender buttermilk biscuit not too dense and along with sausage gravy perfectly complemented rest dish hash brown nice addition well you want heat you should add housemade tomatillo sauce it s not too spicy and add just right amount kick each bite my friend ordered cast iron macaroni and double jammer mimosa u agreed macaroni alright especially in comparison my dish but we enjoyed candied bacon top value brunch spot would say jam cafe pretty good value portion are huge and depending how rich dish may even need packed up afterwards drink however are not worthwhile food but are par value wise with restaurant service we waited more minute our food arrive though longer than would liked quality food more than compensated our waitress also friendly and attentive checked up u ensure we enjoying food and generally top water refill no point we feel rushed in eating ambiance it s cozy space with incredibly interesting decor despite being full house not feel like we packed like sardine and noise level manageable too overall had yet another great experience jam cafe highly recommend place you want avoid lineup i d suggest going either am after pm

my boyfriend and are from seattle and went vancouver weekend we saw jam cafe yelp one their top rated brunch restaurant in area we really wanted check out we came saturday morning about one hour after opened and saw massive line about people and host taking name said going hour and half wait since we only there weekend we not want take up our morning by waiting and eating we decided come back next day we woke especially early and got restaurant right when opened which definitely must like said we there right when opened and restaurant already full we got lucky and grabbed last open booth right next window people came in right after u ended up waiting minute just get seated food absolutely delicious and quality lived you bet would come frequently just try everything menu customer service also exceptional we ordered their black coffee great half portion their bacon egg benedict amazing create your omelette fantastic lemon curd dutch baby alright too much lemon curd and their grapefruit mimosa great wait time get our food decent but we mostly spent time waiting taking picture everything around u honestly i d say one best brunch place i ve ever been from seattle vancouver brunch place would definitely recommend but you come right when open just avoid wait time food and service but wait time

breakfast lunch place worth wait you can few minute before they open am morning cruise and we up sunrise strolling around area taking picture fortunate because we able get in line about minute before by time am rolled around there enough people in line fill every seat in restaurant by time we left there even longer line than there place popular and can vouch it s well deserved menu pretty overwhelming there are lot really good sounding breakfast and lunch option which make really hard choose bfast and lunch are served day two u decided get one savory dish and one sweet dish and we d split them we got charlie bowl and stuffed french toast first up charlie bowl ok thing in man v food category seriously much food could easily make meal even bottomless pit like it s crumbled biscuit hash brown diced ham green onion and cheddar cheese topped with sausage gravy and two sunny side up egg would perfect dish carbo load before marathon best part super tasty one thing consider they also mini charlie bowl that s about regular bowl but more i d still get regular and take home leftover next cracker jack their french toast stuffed with banana and nutella no joke either come with thick sliced piece brioche each slice probably over inch thick there s good amount banana and nutella in there which make really filling also came with bowl fresh fruit side and hefty amount whipped cream top side note they pretty good coffee and house made hot sauce think tomatillo and jalapeno based that s really delicious food also reasonably price esp considering amount food they give and quality hope back really want try their benedict

only my second time having brunch jam cafe and you ve probably gathered from review line ups are sometimes ridiculously long thought going brunch weekday would better but very wrong my friend and waited in line hour before we seated we had planned brunch pm and lined up am but not get seated close pm luckily my friend and had lot catching up and time our hand you plan brunch jam would recommend going right when they open i ve heard wait maybe minute you can always try your luck ever though food jam unparalleled brunch serving size are massive and size not take away from taste delicious last time had smoked salmon egg benedict time went pork belly gravy coop pork belly flavourful my mouth watering just thinking about melt in your mouth kind pork belly buttermilk biscuit dry side but sausage gravy side and sunny side up egg paired well with would liked better hashbrown not packed together because made harder eat with fork and knife but that s just being nit picky also ordered pineapple juice jam cafe boast freshly squeezed juice and my friend absolutely loved their orange juice much ordered two glass not big fan pineapple juice and will likely go different one next time side note their breakfast mimosa are divine price are great food flavour portion and experience jam our server lovely and attentive without being overbearing and that s amazing considering how busy jam cafe restaurant warm setting wood with quirky decoration and had such great chill relaxing atmosphere making easy hear and chat with my friend overall wonderful experience i m already planning my next visit

returned restaurant again wednesday line considerably longer time and had wait over minute get seated decided get cracker jack time along with single red velvet pancake thoroughly enjoyed dish although find price pancake tad high three stack much better deal but even with my massive appetite probably wouldn t been able finish dish again staff member very friendly and quite efficient and turned table very quickly overall really like cafe although i m not quite sure whether i d willing stand in line over minute table again cracker jack consisted two thick slice brioche french toast sandwiching nutella and banana and accompanied by whipped cream and small fruit salad really hard go wrong with nutella and banana and rendition just delicious previously had complained about french toast in their chicken french toast under toasted say bread in dish considerably better with edge being quite crispy interior still soft and fluffy accompanying fruit also nice touch and good palate cleanser sweeter chocolate spread red velvet pancake fair sized pancake although much smaller than one from jethros and elbow room cafe compared latter two spot say had them beat easily pancake soft and cakey and had absolutely no weird smell aftertaste absolutely loved drizzle cream cheese accompanied pancake find price bit high one pancake however full stack much better deal only had larger stomach

come hungry skip meal before coming wear stretchy pant portion are no joke love original location in victoria excited when i d heard they opened one old medina spot wait time min but not feel long hostess came out with mug coffee and waffle sample ppl try they waited great touch and speaks their excellent service food like said everything xxxl sized and food not faint hearted come with appetite we had brioche french toast with banana and strawberry delicous french toast nice and thick with just enough fruit accompany each bite we also ordered egg benedict with fried chicken and corn salsa my only complaint chicken too dry otherwise rest dish pretty good corn salsa nice touch and love how their hash brown are not too oily they bottle green sauce table tasted like salsa verde but wasn t very spicy and delicious with hash brown regular coffee bottomless their london fog good and from jj bean will return next time try their red velvet pancake place beat medina cafe by far in term food and service

had place bookmarked quite time and very excited try out brunch spot downtown vancouver and cozy cafe feelz are thing look in great restaurant being said rather disappointed by place firstly after calling in and asking about wait we told line would die about minute pm we arrived few minute before pm but ended up waiting minute luckily there pokestop nearby bae lured and we killed our wait time once we finally seated we ordered got chicken and waffle admittedly never had chicken and waffle before anxious and excited try new combination food when arrived first thing noticed lukewarm upon first bite tasty sausage gravy had just enough saltiness and combined well with sweeter than normal waffle however chicken dry though will admit disliking chicken breast in general also wished waffle crunchier and fluffier they too soft my liking overall food good enough but certainly not worth minute wait i d much rather go somewhere like red wagon yolk breakfast brunch

hour get table half avocado mediocre food definitely not my jam people just go place cuz there s line up assuming food great which in case but surely not in case jam we tried gravy coop huevos rancheros breakfast skillet chicken french toast and three pig none dish great by mean especially considering you standing in line hour food ok service friendly ambiance hipstery casual worth price and wait nada

after two failed attempt walking from my work in yaletown jam cafe in gastown enjoy brunch jam cafe finally got around eating wanted know what fuss about after hearing approx minute wait every time tried get in it s just egg thought what s big deal third time around my friend and decided suck up and actually wait in cold minute before getting seated we waiting in line waitress brought out waffle u try convinced u stay in line since we had time wait we decided what order soon we got seated smoked salmon egg benedict gravy coupe and single slice red velvet pancake we started with smoked salmon egg benedict incredibly flavourful and definitely lightest one out dish we ordered paired with few piece fruit and hash brown and my goodness those hash brown nice and crisp could ve ate just bowl full hash brown portion large enough make you full but keep you wanting more portion size and quality make salmon benny with most bang your buck in vancouver next up we had grave coupe my favourite out three dish definitely heavy meal mean includes large biscuit fried chicken egg hash brown and sausage gravy carbs carbs carbs would ve never thought egg and chicken would made such nice pairing it s extremely delicious and although felt like going explode by end not want end red velvet pancake not your average pancake it s huge super fluffy and tasted exactly like rich red velvet cake would cream cheese icing great addition making maple syrup unnecessary annoyed am they not take reservation and i ll wait lifetime get seat next time i ll totally come again try their dish homey vibe delicious food large portion and good price make jam cafe huge contender being one best brunch spot in vancouver must try

my husband took vancouver my bday weekend and course very important trip where go breakfast we looked through many yelp review and being pancake are definite must in our life we discovered jam cafe they red velvet pancake their menu and let tell you these pancake melt in your mouth and go straight your stomach especially with heap their cream cheese sauce their coffee very good and perfect complement red velvet pancake had gravy coop which fried chicken patty in two giant biscuit with side sausage gravy yum nice helping hash brown and two perfectly sunny side up egg top chicken and biscuit thoroughly satisfied my husband had herald omelette with cheddar cheese green onion tomato and mushroom added came with hash brown toast sourdough always our choice and chicken apple sausage special request since pork averse my hubby practically licked his plate clean his toast came with special strawberry jam fresh sweet and tasty we asked them we could take home they kindly obliged and gave u two helping take home they also fresh homemade jalapeno sauce really brought out lot flavor in entire omelette yummy our surprise we found out they sell sauce and we quickly said yes please when our server asked we wanted buy we came late around we thankfully missed most rush many people talk about in yelp review and we only waited about min before getting seated we loved rustic atmosphere and decor only downside they accidentally forgot put our order in initially and we waited close half hour before they realized mistake we waited another min before food came out long wait but worth in end bc food good they comped u our pancake and coffee which helped make up time lost well overall place great and we would certainly come again am giving star out bc wait mishap but otherwise top notch

finally decided see what constant line about and wasn t disappointed we thought we would able skip line by going weekday but wasn t case however since line mostly group and we table two we lucky enough get plucked from line and seated before most others great music great decor great service amazing food had buttermilk fried chicken and french toast best breakfast i ve ever had in restaurant my favourite part extra thick bread had most satisfying fluffy texture meal definitely worth wait

vancouver absolutely wonderful city with many wonderful place it s no surprise best restaurant i ve ever been are but there s problem live in burnaby many great restaurant are deep within vancouver city limit which mean i m either going make long frustrating drive make long walk and hop skytrain time i m not going make journey i m lazy and would rather settle something close by however jam cafe will always make long journey first let say love how small and quaint jam cafe kind work against because it s such popular place since it s small there s always huge lineup outside but small venue offer much more intimate dining experience love decoration you feel comfortable and welcomed like you re in your dining room it s incredible atmosphere you will hard pressed find anywhere else i ve been twice breakfast and can honestly say jam cafe provided with two best breakfast s ever had first time went wound up getting gravy coupe and may very well been heaven plate gravy absolutely delicious biscuit soft and flavorful egg cooked perfectly and chicken my goodness chicken what made whole breakfast absolutely divine second time went wound up getting chicken and waffle and just good gravy coupe really like chicken whatever seasoning they use best ever had only real issue with jam cafe like said in my second paragraph because it s such small place incredibly popular you should expect wait outside table quite time my wife and went we wound up waiting in excess minute not problem with waiting and jam cafe certainly worth wait but again expect waiting

lineup are worth met friend brunch am sunday and line moved quickly maybe min staff friendly and attentive taking name and giving time estimate once inside it s relaxed atmosphere but not huge space had red velvet pancake it s giant serving but super tasty not too sweet not quite cake breakfast haha definitely adding one my brunch list

heard about victoria bc location but unfortunately not get chance go one when looking place eat in vancouver excited see there location depending what time day you come there pretty much will line up sort but when we there not take u too long get in my husband ordered breakfast little charlie which really not little bowl big my husband s face not mention mound food we probably should ve shared charlie i m starting think whenever we re in b c and want brunch we should just share order food because most their dish are enormous regardless ordered egg benedict with chorizo which more reasonable size my husband thoroughly enjoyed his charlie bowl although there no way he d even able finish everything well put together and tasty loved my egg benedict because nice spin with chorizo hollandaise sauce wonderfully creamy and delicious we would definitely come back and try dish maybe even come back lunch considering how busy place full and line up outside getting longer their service quite good they regularly come around ask you d like refill coffee and check see you are in need anything waitress pleasant and helpful overall great experience and add wonderful brunch experience we keep having in vancouver and surrounding area they really know how brunch

hype pretty real guy came with friend brunch and we ended up waiting in line only about minute inside little tight but nothing out ordinary busy brunch place we looking menu starting we in line and honestly had hardest time choosing what order almost experienced my mid midlife crisis trying choose matcha pancake special menu and gravy coop ended up going gravy coop probably got few grey hair my friend chose pulled pork pancake and can say wasn t easy decision either portion are huge finished chicken and one two biscuit and honestly felt like champ winning my friend ordered half order pancake and could only finish half pretty delicious usually stay away from fried chicken because not like how greasy tough can but chicken perfectly fried and very tender gravy delicious and biscuit zero complaint pulled pork pancake delicious too good balance different flavour they put in pancake pretty sweet and went really well with pork and cilantro and etc i m honestly just waiting can come back can try something else and super satisfied
